1.verse_text: The truly happy person doesn"t follow wicked advice, doesn"t stand on the road of sinners, and doesn"t sit with the disrespectful. these persons love the LORD "s Instruction, and they recite God"s Instruction day and night! which bears fruit at just the right time and whose leaves don"t fade. Whatever they do succeeds. They are like dust that the wind blows away. neither will sinners in the assembly of the righteous. with the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked is destroyed.
They are like a tree replanted by streams of water,
That"s not true for the wicked!
And that"s why the wicked will have no standing in the court of justice–

2.verse_text: Why do the nations rant? Why do the peoples rave uselessly? the leaders scheme together against the LORD and against his anointed one. 'We will tear off their ropes and throw off their chains!' my Lord makes fun of them. then he terrifies them with his fury: my holy mountain!' He said to me, 'You are my son, today I have become your father. and I will make the nations your possession; the far corners of the earth will be your property. you will shatter them like a pottery jar.' Be warned, you rulers of the earth! trembling, or else he will become angry, and your way will be destroyed because his anger ignites in an instant. But all who take refuge in the LORD are truly happy!
The earth"s rulers take their stand;
The one who rules in heaven laughs;
But then God speaks to them angrily;
'I hereby appoint my king on Zion,
I will announce the LORD "s decision:
You will smash them with an iron rod;

3.verse_text: LORD , I have so many enemies! So many are standing against me. You are my glory! You are the one who restores me. and he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah because the LORD helps me. surrounding me on all sides. Save me, my God! In fact, hit all my enemies on the jaw; shatter the teeth of the wicked! May your blessing be on your people! Selah
So many are talking about me: 'Even God won"t help him.' Selah
But you, LORD , are my shield!
I cry out loud to the LORD ,
I lie down, sleep, and wake up
I won"t be afraid of thousands of people

4.verse_text: Answer me when I cry out, my righteous God! Set me free from my troubles! Have mercy on me! Listen to my prayer! will my reputation be insulted? How long will you continue to love what is worthless and go after lies? Selah personal care of the faithful. The LORD will hear me when I cry out to him. Think hard about it in your bed and weep over it! Selah and trust the LORD ! 'We can"t find goodness anywhere. than when their wheat and wine are everywhere! because you alone, LORD , let me live in safety.
So be afraid, and don"t sin!
Many people say, The light of your face has left us, LORD !'
But you have filled my heart with more joy
I will lie down and fall asleep in peace

5.verse_text: Hear my words, LORD ! Consider my groans! because I am praying to you! In the morning I lay it all out before you. Then I wait expectantly. who enjoys wickedness; evil doesn"t live with you. in your sight; you hate all evildoers; The LORD despises people who are violent and dishonest. because of your abundant, faithful love; I will bow down at your holy temple, honoring you. please lead me in your righteousness. Make your way clear, right in front of me. all they have inside them is destruction. Their throats are open graves; their tongues slick with talk. Let them fail by their own plans. Throw them out for their many sins because they"ve rebelled against you. Let them sing out loud forever! Protect them so that all who love your name can rejoice in you. You cover them with favor like a shield.
Pay attention to the sound of my cries, my king and my God,
LORD , in the morning you hear my voice.
But me? I will enter your house
Because there"s no truth in my enemies" mouths,
But let all who take refuge in you celebrate.
Because you, LORD , bless the righteous.

6.verse_text: Please, LORD , don"t punish me when you are angry; don"t discipline me when you are furious. because I"m frail. Heal me, LORD , because my bones are shaking in terror! But you, LORD ! How long will this last? Save me for the sake of your faithful love! when they are dead. Who gives you thanks Every night, I drench my bed with tears; I soak my couch all the way through. it"s weak because of all my distress. because the LORD has heard me crying! The LORD accepts my prayer. and completely terrified; they will be defeated and ashamed instantly.
My whole body is completely terrified!
Come back to me, LORD ! Deliver me!
No one is going to praise you from the grave?
My vision fails because of my grief;
Get away from me, all you evildoers,
The LORD has listened to my request.
All my enemies will be ashamed

7.verse_text: I take refuge in you, LORD , my God. Save me from all who chase me! Rescue me! dragging me off with no chance of rescue. if my hands have done anything wrong, or oppressed a foe for no reason– not only chase but catch me, trampling my life into the ground, laying my reputation in the dirt. Selah Stand up against the fury of my foes! you command that justice be done! Establish justice for me, LORD , according to my righteousness and according to my integrity. but set the righteous firmly in place because you, the righteous God, are the one who examines hearts and minds. he saves those whose heart is right. God will sharpen his sword, will bend his bow, will string an arrow. for those who won"t change; he gets his flaming arrows ready! conceive trouble, give birth to lies! and then fall right into the hole that they"ve made! will come back on their own heads; the violence they commit will come down on their own skulls. for his righteousness; I will sing praises to the name of the LORD Most High.
Otherwise, they will rip me apart,
LORD , my God, if I have done this–
if I have repaid a friend with evil
Get up, LORD ; get angry! Wake up, my God; Rule them from on high! a God who is angry at evil every single day.
Let the assembled peoples surround you.
The LORD will judge the peoples.
Please let the evil of the wicked be over,
If someone doesn"t change their ways,
God has deadly weapons in store
But look how the wicked hatch evil,
They make a pit, dig it all out,
But I will thank the LORD

8.verse_text: LORD , our Lord, how majestic is your name throughout the earth! you have laid a strong foundation because of your foes, in order to stop vengeful enemies. at what your fingers made– the moon and the stars that you set firmly in place– that you think about them; what are human beings that you pay attention to them? crowning them with glory and grandeur. putting everything under their feet– the wild animals too, the fish of the ocean, everything that travels the pathways of the sea. You made your glory higher than heaven!
From the mouths of nursing babies
When I look up at your skies,
You"ve made them only slightly less than divine,
You"ve let them rule over your handiwork,
LORD , our Lord, how majestic is your name throughout the earth!

9.verse_text: I will thank you, LORD , with all my heart; I will talk about all your wonderful acts. I will sing praises to your name, Most High. they fall down and die right in front of you for me and my claim, because you rule from the throne, establishing justice rightly. destroyed the wicked. You"ve erased their names for all time. like something ruined forever. You"ve torn down their cities– even the memory of them is dead. He assumes his throne for the sake of justice. he will judge all people fairly. a safe place in difficult times. because you have not abandoned any who seek you, LORD . Proclaim his mighty acts among all people! remembers those who suffer; the LORD hasn"t forgotten their cries for help. Just look how I suffer because of those who hate me. But you are the one who brings me back from the very gates of death so I can rejoice in your salvation in the gates of Daughter Zion. into the hole they themselves made! Their feet are caught in the very net they themselves hid! the same for every nation that forgets God. the hope of those who suffer won"t be lost for all time. Let the nations be judged before you. Let the nations know they are only human. Selah
I will celebrate and rejoice in you;
When my enemies turn and retreat,
because you have established justice
You"ve denounced the nations,
Every enemy is wiped out,
But the LORD rules forever!
He will establish justice in the world rightly;
The LORD is a safe place for the oppressed–
Those who know your name trust you
Sing praises to the LORD , who lives in Zion!
Because the one who avenges bloodshed
Have mercy on me, LORD !
so I can declare all your praises,
The nations have fallen
The LORD is famous for the justice he has done; it"s his own doing that the wicked are trapped. Higgayon . Selah
Let the wicked go straight to the grave,
Because the poor won"t be forgotten forever,
Get up, LORD ! Don"t let people prevail!
Strike them with fear, LORD .

10.verse_text: Why do you stand so far away, LORD , hiding yourself in troubling times? in hot pursuit of those who suffer. Let them get caught in the very same schemes they"ve thought up! the greedy reject the LORD , cursing. the wicked don"t seek God: There"s no God– that"s what they are always thinking. Your rules are too lofty for them. They snort at all their foes. We"ll never stumble. We"ll never encounter any resistance. with curses, dishonesty, violence. Under their tongues lie troublemaking and wrongdoing. from their hiding places they kill innocent people; their eyes spot those who are helpless. in secret places, like a lion in its lair. They lie in ambush so they can seize those who suffer! They seize the poor, all right, dragging them off in their nets. they collapse, falling prey to the strength of the wicked. God has forgotten. God has hidden his face. God never sees anything! Get your fist ready, God! Don"t forget the ones who suffer! Why do they think to themselves that you won"t find out? You do see troublemaking and grief, and you do something about it! The helpless leave it all to you. You are the orphan"s helper. who are wicked and evil. Seek out their wickedness until there"s no more to find. The nations will vanish from his land. You steady their hearts; you listen closely to them, for the orphan and the oppressed, so that people of the land will never again be terrified.
The wicked brag about their body"s cravings;
At the peak of their wrath,
They wait in a place perfect for ambush;
Why do the wicked reject God?
The LORD rules forever and always!
LORD , you listen to the desires of those who suffer.

11.verse_text: I have taken refuge in the LORD . So how can you say to me, his very being hates anyone who loves violence. Those whose heart is right will see God"s face. 'Flee to the hills like a bird have already bent their bows; they"ve already strung their arrows; they are ready to secretly shoot those whose heart is right'? what can a righteous person possibly accomplish? The LORD ! His throne is in heaven. His eyes see– his vision examines all of humanity. both the righteous and the wicked; their cups will be filled with nothing but a scorching hot wind He loves righteous deeds.
When the very bottom of things falls out,
But the LORD is in his holy temple.
God will rain fiery coals and sulfur on the wicked;

12.verse_text: Help, LORD , because the godly are all gone; the faithful have completely disappeared from the human race! they talk with slick speech and divided hearts. and every tongue that brags and brags, Who could get the best of us with lips like ours?' 'Because the poor are oppressed, because of the groans of the needy, I"m now standing up. like silver that"s been refined in an oven, purified seven times over! protecting us from this generation forever. while depravity is praised by human beings.
Everyone tells lies to everyone else;
Let the LORD cut off all slick-talking lips
that says, 'We"re unbeatable with our tongues!
But the LORD says, I will provide the help they are gasping for.'
The wicked roam all over the place,

13.verse_text: How long will you forget me, LORD ? Forever? How long will you hide your face from me? agony filling my heart? Daily? How long will my enemy keep defeating me? Answer me, LORD my God! Restore sight to my eyes! Otherwise, I"ll sleep the sleep of death, My foes will rejoice over my downfall. My heart will rejoice in your salvation. because he has been good to me.
How long will I be left to my own wits,
and my enemy will say, 'I won!'
But I have trusted in your faithful love.
Yes, I will sing to the LORD

14.verse_text: Fools say in their hearts, There is no God. They are corrupt and do evil things; not one of them does anything good. to see if anyone is wise, to see if anyone seeks God, Everyone is corrupt. No one does good– not even one person! devouring my people like they are eating bread but never calling on the LORD ? because God is with the righteous generation. the plans of those who suffer, but the LORD is their refuge. When the LORD changes his people"s circumstances for the better, Jacob will rejoice; Israel will celebrate!
The LORD looks down from heaven on humans
but all of them have turned bad.
Are they dumb, all these evildoers,
Count on it: they will be in utter panic
Let Israel"s salvation come out of Zion!

15.verse_text: Who can live in your tent, LORD ? Who can dwell on your holy mountain? lives free of blame, does what is right, and speaks the truth sincerely; does no harm to a friend, doesn"t insult a neighbor; those who act wickedly, but who honors those who honor the LORD ; someone who keeps their promise even when it hurts; who won"t accept a bribe against any innocent person. Whoever does these things will never stumble.
who does no damage with their talk,
someone who doesn"t lend money with interest,

16.verse_text: Protect me, God, because I take refuge in you. Apart from you, I have nothing good.' the 'magnificent ones' that I was so happy about; I won"t participate in their blood offerings; I won"t let their names cross my lips. you control my destiny. yes, I have a lovely home. even at night I am instructed in the depths of my mind. I will not stumble because he is on my right side. yes, my whole body will rest in safety you won"t let your faithful follower see the pit. In your presence is total celebration. Beautiful things are always in your right hand.
I say to the LORD , 'You are my Lord.
Now as for the 'holy ones' in the land,
let their suffering increase because they hurried after a different god.
You, LORD , are my portion, my cup;
The property lines have fallen beautifully for me;
I will bless the LORD who advises me;
I always put the LORD in front of me;
That"s why my heart celebrates and my mood is joyous;
because you won"t abandon my life to the grave;
You teach me the way of life.

17.verse_text: Listen to what"s right, LORD ; pay attention to my cry! Listen closely to my prayer; it"s spoken by lips that don"t lie! let your eyes see what is right! testing me at night. You"ve looked me over closely, but haven"t found anything wrong. My mouth doesn"t sin. I have avoided such violent ways by the command from your lips. my feet haven"t slipped. So tilt your ears toward me now– listen to what I"m saying! because you are the one who saves those who take refuge in you, saving them from their attackers by your strong hand. Hide me in the protection of your wings, who are out to get me, away from my deadly enemies who are all around me! their mouths speak arrogantly. suddenly, they surround me! They make their plans to put me in the dirt. they are like a strong young lion lying in wait. Confront them! Bring them down! Rescue my life from the wicked– use your sword! use your own hands, LORD ! Rescue me from these people But fill the stomachs of your cherished ones; let their children be filled full so that they have leftovers enough for their babies. when I awake, I will be filled full by seeing your image.
My steps are set firmly on your paths;
I cry out to you because you answer me.
Manifest your faithful love in amazing ways
Watch me with the very pupil of your eye!
They are like a lion eager to rip its prey;
Rescue me from these people– whose only possession is their fleeting life.
But me? I will see your face in righteousness;

18.verse_text: He said: I love you, LORD , my strength. my fortress, my rescuer. My God is my rock– I take refuge in him!– he"s my shield, my salvation"s strength, my place of safety. I cried out to the LORD , and I was saved from my enemies. rivers of wickedness terrified me. death"s traps held me tight. I called to my God for help. God heard my voice from his temple; I called to him for help, and my call reached his ears. the bases of the mountains trembled and reeled because of God"s anger. out of his mouth came a devouring fire; flaming coals blazed out in front of him! thick darkness was beneath his feet. he soared on the wings of the wind. his covering was dark water and dense cloud. of the brightness before him; hail and coals of fire went too. the Most High made his voice heard with hail and coals of fire. he sent the lightning and threw them into confusion. the earth"s foundations were laid bare at your rebuke, LORD , at the angry blast of air coming from your nostrils. he took me out of all that water. saved me from my foes, who were too much for me. but the LORD was my support. he pulled me out safe because he is pleased with me. he restored me because my hands are clean, I haven"t acted wickedly against my God. I haven"t turned away from any of his laws. I"ve kept myself from wrongdoing. because my hands are clean in his eyes. you show integrity toward the one who has integrity. but toward the crooked, you are tricky. and brings down those with proud eyes. the LORD my God illumines my darkness. with my God I can leap over a wall. the LORD "s word is tried and true. He is a shield for all who take refuge in him. And who is a rock but our God? and makes my way perfect, who lets me stand securely on the heights, so my arms can bend a bronze bow. your strong hand has supported me; your help has made me great. without even twisting an ankle. I didn"t come home until I finished them off. they couldn"t get up again; they fell under my feet. you brought my adversaries down underneath me. I destroyed my foes. but there was no one to save them. They cried for help to the LORD , but he wouldn"t answer them. like dust blown away by the wind; I threw them out like mud dumped in the streets. you appointed me the leader of many nations. Strangers come to serve me. foreigners grovel before me. Let the God of my salvation be lifted high! who subdues people before me, Yes, you lifted me high above my adversaries; you delivered me from violent people. in the presence of the nations. That"s why I sing praises to your name. who shows faithful love to your anointed one– to David and to his descendants forever.
The LORD is my solid rock,
Because he is praiseworthy,
Death"s cords were wrapped around me;
The cords of the grave surrounded me;
In my distress I cried out to the LORD ;
The earth rocked and shook;
Smoke went up from God"s nostrils;
God parted the skies and came down;
God mounted the heavenly creatures and flew;
God made darkness cloak him;
God"s clouds went ahead
The LORD thundered in heaven;
God shot his arrows, scattering the enemy;
The seabeds were exposed;
From on high God reached down and grabbed me;
God saved me from my powerful enemy,
They came at me on the very day of my distress,
He brought me out to wide-open spaces;
The LORD rewarded me for my righteousness;
because I have kept the LORD "s ways.
All his rules are right in front of me;
I have lived with integrity before him;
And so the LORD restored me for my righteousness
You deal faithfully with the faithful;
You are pure toward the pure,
You are the one who saves people who suffer
You are the one who lights my lamp–
With you I can charge into battle;
God! His way is perfect;
Now really, who is divine except the LORD ?
Only God! The God who equips me with strength
who makes my step as sure as the deer"s,
who trains my hands for war
You"ve given me the shield of your salvation;
You"ve let me walk fast and safe,
I chased my enemies and caught them!
I struck them down;
You equipped me with strength for war;
You made my enemies turn tail from me;
They cried for help,
I crushed them
You delivered me from struggles with many people;
After hearing about me, they obey me;
Foreigners lose their nerve; they come trembling out of their fortresses.
The LORD lives! Bless God, my rock!
This is the God who avenges on my behalf,
who delivers me from my enemies.
That"s why I thank you, LORD ,
You are the one who gives great victories to your king,

19.verse_text: Heaven is declaring God"s glory; the sky is proclaiming his handiwork. and one night informs another what needs to be known. their voices can"t be heard– their words reach the ends of the earth. God has made a tent in heaven for the sun. coming out of his honeymoon suite; like a warrior, it thrills at running its course. its circuit is complete at the other. Nothing escapes its heat. The LORD "s laws are faithful, making naive people wise. gladdening the heart. The LORD "s commands are pure, giving light to the eyes. lasting forever. The LORD "s judgments are true. All of these are righteous! than tons of pure gold! They are sweeter than honey– even dripping off the honeycomb! your servant is enlightened by them; there is great reward in keeping them. what they"ve accidentally done wrong? Clear me of any unknown sin Don"t let them rule me. Then I"ll be completely blameless; I"ll be innocent of great wrongdoing. and the meditations of my heart be pleasing to you, LORD , my rock and my redeemer.
One day gushes the news to the next,
Of course, there"s no speech, no words–
but their sound extends throughout the world;
The sun is like a groom
It rises in one end of the sky;
The LORD "s Instruction is perfect, reviving one"s very being.
They are more desirable than gold–
and save your servant from willful sins.
Let the words of my mouth

20.verse_text: I pray that the LORD answers you whenever you are in trouble. Let the name of Jacob"s God protect you. and support you from Zion. let him savor your entirely burned offerings. Selah and fulfill all your plans. We will fly our flags in the name of our God. Let the LORD fulfill all your requests! God answers his anointed one from his heavenly sanctuary, answering with mighty acts of salvation achieved by his strong hand. but we praise the LORD "s name. but we will stand up straight and strong. Let him answer us when we cry out!
Let God send help to you from the sanctuary
Let God recall your many grain offerings;
Let God grant what is in your heart
Then we will rejoice that you"ve been helped.
Now I know that the LORD saves his anointed one;
Some people trust in chariots, others in horses;

21.verse_text: The king celebrates your strength, LORD ; look how happy he is about your saving help! you haven"t denied what his lips requested. Selah you put a crown of pure gold on his head. and you gave it to him, all right– long days, forever and always! because of your saving help; you"ve conferred on him glory and grandeur. you make him happy with the joy of your presence. and because of the Most High"s faithful love, he will not stumble. your strong hand will catch all who hate you. you will light them up like an oven on fire. God will eat them whole in his anger; fire will devour them. destroy their descendants from the human race. they devised a wicked plan–but they will fail! when you aim your bow straight at their faces! We will sing and praise your power!
You"ve given him what his heart desires;
You bring rich blessings right to him;
Because the king trusts the LORD ,
Your hand will catch all your enemies;
You will destroy their offspring from the land;
Because they sought to do you harm,
Because you will make them turn and run
Be exalted, LORD , in your strength!

22.verse_text: My God! My God, why have you left me all alone? Why are you so far from saving me– so far from my anguished groans? but you don"t answer; even at nighttime I don"t stop. You are Israel"s praise. they trusted you and you rescued them; they trusted you and they weren"t ashamed. insulted by one person, despised by another. they gape, shaking their heads: so let God rescue him; let God deliver him because God likes him so much.' placing me safely at my mother"s breasts. you"ve been my God since I was in my mother"s womb. because trouble is near and there"s no one to help. mighty bulls from Bashan encircle me. like a lion ripping and roaring! All my bones have fallen apart. My heart is like wax; it melts inside me. like a piece of broken pottery. My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; you"ve set me down in the dirt of death. a pack of evil people circle me like a lion– oh, my poor hands and feet! Meanwhile, they just stare at me, watching me. they cast lots for my clothes. You are my strength! Come quick and help me! Deliver my life from the power of the dog. From the horns of the wild oxen you have answered me! I will praise you in the very center of the congregation! All of you who are Jacob"s descendants–honor him! All of you who are all Israel"s offspring– stand in awe of him! the suffering of the one who suffered– he didn"t hide his face from me. No, he listened when I cried out to him for help. because of you; I will fulfill my promises in the presence of those who honor God. Let all who seek the LORD praise him! I pray your hearts live forever! will remember and come back to the LORD ; every family among all the nations will worship you. he rules all nations. all who are descending to the dust will kneel before him; generations to come will be told about my Lord. to those not yet born, telling them what God has done.
My God, I cry out during the day,
You are the holy one, enthroned.
Our ancestors trusted you–
they cried out to you and they were saved;
But I"m just a worm, less than human;
All who see me make fun of me–
'He committed himself to the LORD ,
But you are the one who pulled me from the womb,
I was thrown on you from birth;
Please don"t be far from me,
Many bulls surround me;
They open their mouths at me
I"m poured out like water.
My strength is dried up
Dogs surround me;
I can count all my bones!
They divvy up my garments among themselves;
But you, LORD ! Don"t be far away!
Deliver me from the sword.
Save me from the mouth of the lion.
I will declare your name to my brothers and sisters;
All of you who revere the LORD –praise him!
Because he didn"t despise or detest
I offer praise in the great congregation
Let all those who are suffering eat and be full!
Every part of the earth
Because the right to rule belongs to the LORD ,
Indeed, all the earth"s powerful will worship him; my being also lives for him.
Future descendants will serve him;
They will proclaim God"s righteousness

23.verse_text: The LORD is my shepherd. I lack nothing. he leads me to restful waters; He guides me in proper paths for the sake of his good name. I fear no danger because you are with me. Your rod and your staff– they protect me. right in front of my enemies. You bathe my head in oil; my cup is so full it spills over! will pursue me all the days of my life, as long as I live.
He lets me rest in grassy meadows;
Even when I walk through the darkest valley,
You set a table for me
Yes, goodness and faithful love and I will live in the LORD "s house

24.verse_text: The earth is the LORD "s and everything in it, the world and its inhabitants too. God set it firmly on the waters. Who can stand in his holy sanctuary? the one who hasn"t made false promises, the one who hasn"t sworn dishonestly. and righteousness from the God who saves. with the generation that seeks him– Ancient doors: rise up high! So the glorious king can enter! The LORD –strong and powerful! The LORD –powerful in battle! Ancient doors: rise up high! So the glorious king can enter! The LORD of heavenly forces– he is the glorious king! Selah
Because God is the one who established it on the seas;
Who can ascend the LORD "s mountain?
Only the one with clean hands and a pure heart;
That kind of person receives blessings from the LORD
And that"s how things are that seeks the face of Jacob"s God. Selah
Mighty gates: lift up your heads!
Mighty gates: lift up your heads!

25.verse_text: I offer my life to you, LORD . Please don"t let me be put to shame! Don"t let my enemies rejoice over me! don"t let anyone who hopes in you be put to shame; instead, let those who are treacherous without excuse be put to shame. teach me your paths. because you are the God who saves me. I put my hope in you all day long. they are forever! Remember me only according to your faithful love for the sake of your goodness, LORD . he teaches sinners which way they should go. teaching them his way. for those who keep his covenant and laws. God will teach them which path to take. and their descendants will possess the land. he makes his covenant known to them. because he will free my feet from the net. because I"m alone and suffering. set me free from my distress! forgive all my sins! and how violently they hate me! Don"t let me be put to shame because I take refuge in you. because I hope in you.
My God, I trust you.
For that matter,
Make your ways known to me, LORD ;
Lead me in your truth–teach it to me–
LORD , remember your compassion and faithful love–
But don"t remember the sins of my youth or my wrongdoing.
The LORD is good and does the right thing;
God guides the weak to justice,
All the LORD "s paths are loving and faithful
Please, for the sake of your good name, LORD , forgive my sins, which are many!
Where are the ones who honor the LORD ?
They will live a good life,
The LORD counsels those who honor him;
My eyes are always looking to the LORD
Turn to me, God, and have mercy on me
My heart"s troubles keep getting bigger–
Look at my suffering and trouble–
Look at how many enemies I have
Please protect my life! Deliver me!
Let integrity and virtue guard me
Please, God, save Israel from all its troubles!

26.verse_text: Establish justice for me, LORD , because I have walked with integrity. I"ve trusted the LORD without wavering. I walk in your truth! I don"t keep company with liars. and I don"t sit with wicked people. I walk all around your altar, LORD , declaring all your wonderful deeds! I love the place where your glory resides. taking my life along with violent people whose strong hands are full of bribes. Save me! Have mercy on me! I will bless the LORD in the great congregation.
Examine me, LORD ; put me to the test! Purify my mind and my heart.
Because your faithful love is right in front of me–
I don"t spend time with people up to no good;
I detest the company of evildoers,
I wash my hands–they are innocent!
I love the beauty of your house, LORD ;
Don"t gather me up with the sinners,
in whose hands are evil schemes,
But me? I walk with integrity.
My feet now stand on level ground.

45.verse_text: A marvelous word has stirred my heart as I mention my works to the king. My tongue is the pen of a skillful scribe. grace has been poured out on your lips. No wonder God has blessed you forever! with your glory and grandeur. Ride out on behalf of truth, humility, and righteousness! May your sharp arrows pierce the hearts of the king"s enemies. Your royal scepter is a scepter of justice. No wonder God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy more than all your companions! The music of stringed instruments coming from ivory palaces entertains you. the queen stands at your right, dressed in the gold of Ophir. Forget your people and your father"s house. Because he is your master, bow down to him now. will seek your favor with gifts, her robe embroidered with gold. Her attendants, the young women servants following her, are presented to you as well. they are led in with celebration and joy. you will appoint them as princes throughout the land. so the peoples will praise you forever and always.
You are the most handsome of men;
Strap on your sword, great warrior,
Go and succeed in your grandeur! Let your strong hand perform awesome deeds. for the royal princess, dressed in pearls,
Let the peoples fall beneath you.
Your divine throne is eternal and everlasting.
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
All your clothes have the pleasing scent of myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
The royal princess is standing in your precious jewels;
Listen, daughter; pay attention, and listen closely!
Let the king desire your beauty.
The city of Tyre, the wealthiest of all,
In robes of many colors, she is led to the king.
As they enter the king"s palace,
Your sons, great king, will succeed your fathers;
I will perpetuate your name from one generation to the next

46.verse_text: God is our refuge and strength, a help always near in times of great trouble. when the mountains crumble into the center of the sea, when the mountains shake because of its surging waves. Selah the holiest dwelling of the Most High. God will help it when morning dawns. God utters his voice; the earth melts. The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah what devastation he has imposed on the earth– breaking the bow and shattering the spear, burning chariots with fire. I am exalted among all nations; I am exalted throughout the world!' The God of Jacob is our place of safety. Selah
That"s why we won"t be afraid when the world falls apart,
when its waters roar and rage,
There is a river whose streams gladden God"s city,
God is in that city. It will never crumble.
The LORD of heavenly forces is with us!
bringing wars to an end in every corner of the world,
'That"s enough! Now know that I am God!
The LORD of heavenly forces is with us!

47.verse_text: Clap your hands, all you people! Shout joyfully to God with a joyous shout! he is the great king of the whole world. subdues all people beneath our feet. the heights of Jacob, which he loves. Selah the LORD with the blast of the ram"s horn. Sing praises to our king! Sing praises God sits on his holy throne. with the people of Abraham"s God because the earth"s guardians belong to God; God is exalted beyond all.
Because the LORD Most High is awesome,
He subdues the nations under us,
He chooses our inheritance for us:
God has gone up with a joyous shout–
Sing praises to God! Sing praises!
because God is king of the whole world! Sing praises with a song of instruction!
God is king over the nations.
The leaders of all people are gathered

48.verse_text: In the city belonging to our God, the LORD is great and so worthy of praise! His holy mountain the joy of the whole world. Mount Zion, in the far north, is the city of the great king. revealing himself as a place of safety. advancing all together– they panicked and ran away frightened. like a woman giving birth, the ships of Tarshish. now we"ve seen it for ourselves in the city of the LORD of heavenly forces, in the city of our God. May God make it secure forever! Selah in your temple. extends to the far corners of the earth. Your strong hand is filled with righteousness. let the towns of Judah rejoice because of your acts of justice! go all the way around it; count its towers. tour its fortifications so that you may tell future generations: our God, forever and always! He is the one who will lead us
when they saw it, they were stunned;
Trembling took hold of them right there–
or like the east wind when it smashes
We dwell on your faithful love, God,
Your praise, God, just like your reputation,
'This is God, even to the very end.'

49.verse_text: Listen to this, all you people! Listen closely, all you citizens of the world– rich and poor alike! my heart"s meditation is full of insight. I will explain my riddle on the lyre. when the wrongdoing of my bullies engulfs me– and boast of their fantastic wealth? It can"t pay a life"s ransom-price to God. wealth will never be enough– without experiencing the pit. just like foolish and stupid people do, all of them leaving their fortunes to others. the place they live for all generations, even if they had counties named after them! they"re just like the animals that pass away. as well as for those who follow their lead, pleased with their talk. Selah Death will be their shepherd– but those who do right in their hearts will rule over them come morning!– their forms wasting away in the grave because he will take me. Selah their house swelling to fantastic proportions, Their fantastic things won"t accompany them down under. they too will never see the light again. they"re just like the animals that pass away.
people of every kind,
My mouth speaks wisdom;
I will pay close attention to a proverb;
Why should I be afraid in times of trouble,
those people who trust in their fortunes
Wealth? It can"t save a single person!
The price to save someone"s life is too high–
no one can live forever
Everyone knows that the wise die too,
Their graves are their eternal homes,
People won"t live any longer because of wealth;
That"s how it goes for those who are foolish,
Like sheep, they"re headed straight for the grave. rather than having some dignified residence. and even thank you when you deal well with them,
But God will save my life from the power of the grave,
Don"t be overly impressed when someone becomes rich,
because when they die, they won"t take any of it with them.
Though they consider themselves blessed during their lives,
they too will join the ancestors who"ve gone ahead;
Wealthy people? They just don"t understand;

50.verse_text: From the rising of the sun to where it sets, God, the LORD God, speaks, calling out to the earth. God shines brightly. he won"t keep quiet. A devouring fire is before him; a storm rages all around him. and to the earth in order to judge his people: those who made a covenant with me by sacrifice.' because God himself is the judge. Selah Israel, I will now testify against you. I am God–your God! or for your entirely burned offerings, which are always before me. or goats from your corrals as do the cattle on a thousand hills. even the insects in the fields are mine. because the whole world and everything in it already belong to me. Do I drink goats" blood? Fulfill the promises you made to the Most High! I will deliver you, then you will honor me.' 'Why do you talk about my laws? Why do you even mention my covenant? you toss my words behind your back. you spend your time with adulterers. then harness your tongue to tell lies. you find fault with the children of your very own mother. You thought I was just like you! But now I"m punishing you; I"m laying it all out, right in front of your face. or I"ll rip you to pieces with no one to deliver you: And it is to the one who charts the correct path that I will show divine salvation.'
From Zion, perfect in beauty,
Our God is coming;
God calls out to the skies above
'Bring my faithful to me,
The skies proclaim his righteousness
'Listen, my people, I will now speak;
I"m not punishing you for your sacrifices
I won"t accept bulls from your house
because every forest animal already belongs to me,
I know every mountain bird;
Even if I were hungry, I wouldn"t tell you
Do I eat bulls" meat?
Offer God a sacrifice of thanksgiving!
Cry out to me whenever you are in trouble;
But to the wicked God says,
You hate discipline, and
You make friends with thieves whenever you see one;
You set your mouth free to do evil,
You sit around, talking about your own siblings;
You"ve done these things and I"ve kept quiet.
So consider this carefully, all you who forget God,
The one who offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving is the one who honors me.

51.verse_text: Have mercy on me, God, according to your faithful love! Wipe away my wrongdoings according to your great compassion! purify me from my sin! my sin is always right in front of me. I"ve committed evil in your sight. That"s why you are justified when you render your verdict, completely correct when you issue your judgment. from the moment my mother conceived me. wash me and I will be whiter than snow. let the bones you crushed rejoice once more. wipe away all my guilty deeds! put a new, faithful spirit deep inside me! please don"t take your holy spirit away from me. and sustain me with a willing spirit. and sinners will come back to you. so that my tongue can sing of your righteousness. and my mouth will proclaim your praise. If I gave an entirely burned offering, you wouldn"t be pleased. You won"t despise a heart, God, that is broken and crushed. Rebuild Jerusalem"s walls. entirely burned offerings and complete offerings. Then bulls will again be sacrificed on your altar.
Wash me completely clean of my guilt;
Yes, I was born in guilt, in sin,
And yes, you want truth in the most hidden places; you teach me wisdom in the most secret space.
Purify me with hyssop and I will be clean;
Let me hear joy and celebration again;
Hide your face from my sins;
Create a clean heart for me, God;
Please don"t throw me out of your presence;
Return the joy of your salvation to me
Then I will teach wrongdoers your ways,
Deliver me from violence, God, God of my salvation,
A broken spirit is my sacrifice, God.
Do good things for Zion by your favor.
Then you will again want sacrifices of righteousness–

52.verse_text: Hey, powerful person! Why do you brag about evil? God"s faithful love lasts all day long. it"s like a sharpened razor, causing deception. you love lying more than speaking what is right. Selah you love the deceiving tongue. he will snatch you up, tear you out of your tent, and uproot you from the land of the living! Selah they will laugh at those people: Instead, they trusted in their own great wealth. They sought refuge in it–to their own destruction!' I trust in God"s faithful love forever and always. because you have acted. In the presence of your faithful people, I will hope in your name because it"s so good.
You love evil more than good;
But God will take you down permanently;
The righteous will see and be in awe;
'Look at them! They didn"t make God their refuge.
But I am like a green olive tree in God"s house;
I will give thanks to you, God, forever,

53.verse_text: Fools say in their hearts, There"s no God. They are corrupt and do horrible deeds; not one of them does anything good. to see if anyone is wise, to see if anyone seeks God. Everyone is corrupt. No one does good– not even one person! devouring my people like they are eating bread but never calling on God? they will be in utter panic because God will scatter the bones of those who attacked you. You will put them to shame because God has rejected them. When God changes his people"s circumstances for the better, Jacob will rejoice; Israel will celebrate!
God looks down from heaven on humans
There, where there was nothing to fear,
Let Israel"s salvation come out of Zion!

54.verse_text: God! Save me by your name; defend me by your might! listen to the words of my mouth! violent people want me dead. They pay no attention to God. Selah my Lord sustains my life. By your faithfulness, God, destroy them! I will give thanks to your name, LORD , because it"s so good, from every distress.
The proud have come up against me;
But look here: God is my helper;
He will bring disaster on my opponents.
I will sacrifice to you freely;
and because God has delivered me My eyes have seen my enemies" defeat.

55.verse_text: God, listen to my prayer; don"t avoid my request! I can"t sit still while complaining. I"m beside myself at the wicked person"s racket, because they bring disaster on me and harass me furiously. because death"s terrors have reached me. I"m shaking all over. I wish I had wings like a dove! I"d fly away and rest. I"d live in the desert. Selah far from the rushing wind and storm. Confuse their language because I see violence and conflict in the city. and evil and misery live inside it. oppression and fraud never leave the town square. I could handle that. It"s not someone who hates me who is exalted over me– I could hide from them. my close companion, my good friend! together we entered God"s house with the crowd. because evil lives with them– even inside them! and the LORD will rescue me. I complain and moan so that God will hear my voice. though there are many who are out to get me. will hear and humble them Selah because they don"t change and they don"t worship God. breaking his covenant. war is in his heart; though his words are more silky than oil, they are really drawn swords: he will support you! God will never let the righteous be shaken!' down to the deepest pit. Let bloodthirsty and treacherous people not live out even half their days. But me? I trust in you!
My heart pounds in my chest
Fear and trembling have come upon me;
Day and night they make their rounds on its walls,
It"s not an enemy that is insulting me–
Let death devastate my enemies; let them go to the grave alive
But I call out to God,
He saves me, unharmed, from my struggle,
God, who is enthroned from ancient days,
Though his talk is smoother than butter,
But you, God, bring the wicked

56.verse_text: God, have mercy on me because I"m being trampled. All day long the enemy oppresses me. because I have so many enemies. Exalted one, I put my trust in you– I trust in God; I won"t be afraid. What can mere flesh do to me? all their thoughts are evil against me. they are watching my steps, hoping for my death. In wrath bring down the people, God! Put my tears into your bottle– aren"t they on your scroll already? I know this because God is mine. The LORD : whose word I praise. What can anyone do to me? I will present thanksgiving offerings to you saved my feet from stumbling so that I can walk before God in the light of life.
My attackers trample me all day long
in God, whose word I praise.
All day long they frustrate my pursuits;
They get together and set an ambush–
Don"t rescue them for any reason!
You yourself have kept track of my misery.
Then my enemies will retreat when I cry out.
I trust in God; I won"t be afraid.
I will fulfill my promises to you, God.
because you have saved my life from death,

57.verse_text: Have mercy on me, God; have mercy on me I take refuge in the shadow of your wings until destruction passes by. to God, who comes through for me. rebukes the one who tramples me. Selah God sends his loyal love and faithfulness. I lie down among those who devour humans. Their teeth are spears and arrows; their tongues are sharpened swords. Let your glory be over all the earth! they dug a pit for me, but they fell into it instead! Selah my heart is unwavering. I will sing and make music. Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake the dawn itself! my Lord, among all the peoples; I will make music to you among the nations is as high as heaven; your faithfulness reaches the clouds. Let your glory be over all the earth! because I have taken refuge in you.
I call out to God Most High–
He sends orders from heaven and saves me,
My life is in the middle of a pack of lions.
Exalt yourself, God, higher than heaven!
They laid a net for my feet to bring me down;
I will give thanks to you,
Exalt yourself, God, higher than heaven!

58.verse_text: Do you really speak what is right, you gods? Do you really judge humans fairly? your hands do violence on the earth. liars go astray from birth. like a deaf cobra"s–one that shuts its ears or the spells of a skillful enchanter. Tear out the lions" jawbones, LORD ! When they bend the bow, like a woman"s stillborn child, let them never see the sun. whether green or burned up, when they wash their feet in the blood of the wicked. 'Yes, there is a reward for the righteous! Yes, there is a God who judges people on the earth.'
No: in your hearts you plan injustice;
The wicked backslide from the womb;
Their venom is like a snake"s venom–
so it can"t hear the snake charmer"s voice
God, break their teeth out of their mouths!
Let them dissolve like water flowing away. let their arrows be like headless shafts. God will sweep them away!
Like the snail that dissolves into slime,
Before your pots feel the thorns,
But the righteous will rejoice when they see vengeance done,

59.verse_text: Oh, my God, deliver me from my enemies; put me out of reach from those who rise up against me. save me from the bloodthirsty. Powerful people are attacking me, LORD – but not because of any error or sin of mine. but not because of any fault of mine. Get up when I cry out to you! Look at what"s happening! the God of Israel! Wake up and punish all the nations! Grant no mercy to any wicked traitor! Selah growling like dogs, prowling around the city. swords are between their lips! You mock all the nations. because God is my stronghold. God will allow me to look down on my enemies. instead, by your power shake them up and bring them down, you who are our shield and my Lord. the words that they speak, let them be captured in their pride. For the curses and lies they repeat, finish them off until they are gone! Then let it be known to the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob. Selah growling like dogs, prowling around the city. and if they don"t get their fill, they stay all night. In the morning I will shout out loud about your faithful love because you have been my stronghold, my shelter when I was distraught. because God is my stronghold, my loving God.
Look at how they lie in ambush for my life!
They run and take their stand–
You are the LORD God of heavenly forces,
See what they belch out with their mouths: Who can listen to them?
But you, LORD , laugh at them.
I keep looking for you, my strength,
My loving God will come to meet me.
Don"t kill them, or my people might forget;
For the sin of their mouths,
But me? I will sing of your strength!
I will sing praises to you, my strength,

60.verse_text: God, you have rejected us– shattered us. You"ve been so angry. Now restore us! splitting it open. Now repair its cracks because it"s shaking apart! you"ve given us wine and we stagger. so they can rally around it, so that the people you love might be rescued. 'I will celebrate as I divide up Shechem and portion out the Succoth Valley. Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter. I"ll throw my shoe at Edom. I wish someone would lead me to Edom!' God, you no longer accompany our armies. human help is worthless. he"s the one who will trample our adversaries.
You"ve made your people suffer hardship;
Give a flag to those who honor you, safe from attack. Selah I shout in triumph over Philistia!
Save us by your power and answer us
God has spoken in his sanctuary:
I wish someone would bring me to a fortified city!
But you have rejected us, God, haven"t you?
Give us help against the enemy;

61.verse_text: God, listen to my cry; pay attention to my prayer! I cry out to you from the very ends of the earth. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I am a tower of strength in the face of the enemy. Please let me take refuge in the shelter of your wings! Selah as those who honor your name. Let his years extend for many generations! Make it so love and faithfulness watch over him! and I will do what I promised every single day.
because you have been my refuge,
Please let me live in your tent forever!
Because you, God, have heard my promises; you"ve given me the same possession
Add days to the king"s life!
Let him be enthroned forever before God!
Then I will sing praises to your name forever,

62.verse_text: Only in God do I find rest; my salvation comes from him. my stronghold!–I won"t be shaken anymore. as if they were leaning walls or broken-down fences? is to bring others down low; they delight in deception. With their mouths they bless, but inside they are cursing. Selah because my hope comes from him! my stronghold!–I will not be shaken. God is my strong rock. My refuge is in God. Pour out your hearts before him! God is our refuge! Selah Human beings are nothing but lies. They don"t even register on a scale; taken all together they are lighter than a breath! don"t set false hopes in robbery. When wealth bears fruit, don"t set your heart on it. make it two things– that I myself have heard: that strength belongs to God, and that you will repay everyone according to their deeds.
Only God is my rock and my salvation–
How long will all of you attack others; how long will you tear them down
The only desire of this people
Oh, I must find rest in God only,
Only God is my rock and my salvation–
My deliverance and glory depend on God.
All you people: Trust in him at all times!
Human beings are nothing but a breath.
and faithful love comes from you, my Lord–

63.verse_text: God! My God! It"s you– I search for you! My body desires you in a dry and tired land, no water anywhere. I"ve seen your power and glory. because your faithful love is better than life itself! I will lift up my hands in your name. as with a rich dinner. My mouth speaks praise with joy on my lips– whenever I meditate on you in the middle of the night– your strong hand upholds me. Let them go into the bowels of the earth! Let them be food for wild jackals! everyone who swears by God should give praise when the mouths of liars are shut for good. My whole being thirsts for you!
Yes, I"ve seen you in the sanctuary;
So I will bless you as long as I"m alive;
whenever I ponder you on my bed,
because you"ve been a help to me and I shout for joy in the protection of your wings.
My whole being clings to you;
But what about those people who want to destroy me?
Let their blood flow by the sword!
But the king should rejoice in God;

64.verse_text: Listen to me when I complain, God! Protect my life from the enemy"s terror! hide me from the schemes of evildoers They aim their arrow–a cruel word– so as to shoot an innocent person. They shoot without warning and without fear. They plan on laying traps in secret. 'Who will be able to see them?' they ask. We"ve devised a perfect plot! Without warning, they will be wounded! everyone who sees them will just shake their heads. will announce the act of God, will understand it was God"s work. let them take refuge in him; let everyone whose heart is in the right place give praise!
Hide me from the secret plots of wicked people;
who sharpen their tongues like swords.
They encourage themselves with evil words.
'Let someone try to expose our crimes! It"s deep within the human mind and heart.'
But God will shoot them with an arrow!
The LORD will make them trip over their own tongues;
Then all people will honor God,
Let the righteous rejoice in the LORD ;

65.verse_text: God of Zion, to you even silence is praise. Promises made to you are kept– and all living things come to you. you forgive our sins. the one who lives in your courtyards! We are filled full by the goodness of your house, by the holiness of your temple. by your awesome deeds, God of our salvation– you, who are the security of all the far edges of the earth, even the distant seas. you are dressed in raw power. calm the roaring waves, calm the noise of the nations. stand in awe of your acts. You make the gateways of morning and evening sing for joy. enriching it greatly by God"s stream, full of water. You provide people with grain because that is what you"ve decided. leveling its ridges, you soften it with rain showers; you bless its growth. your paths overflow with rich food. and the hills are dressed in pure joy. the valleys decked out in grain– they shout for joy; they break out in song!
When wrongdoings become too much for me,
How happy is the one you choose to bring close,
You establish the mountains by your strength;
Those who dwell on the far edges
You visit the earth and make it abundant,
You crown the year with your goodness;
Even the desert pastures drip with it,
The meadowlands are covered with flocks,

66.verse_text: Shout joyfully to God, all the earth! Make glorious his praise! 'How awesome are your works! Because of your great strength, your enemies cringe before you. sings praises to you, sings praises to your name!' Selah his works for human beings are awesome: so they could cross the river on foot. Right there we rejoiced in him! keeps a good eye on the nations. So don"t let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah Let the sound of his praise be heard! he didn"t let our feet slip a bit. you"ve refined us like silver, laid burdens on our backs, we"ve been through fire and water. But you brought us out to freedom! with entirely burned offerings. I"ll keep the promises I made to you, the ones my mouth spoke when I was in deep trouble. along with the smoke of sacrificed rams. I will offer both bulls and goats. Selah all you who honor God; I will tell you what God has done for me: with praise on my tongue. my Lord would not have listened. He heard the sound of my prayer. he didn"t withhold his faithful love from me.
Sing praises to the glory of God"s name!
Say to God:
All the earth worships you,
Come and see God"s deeds;
He turned the sea into dry land
God rules with power forever;
All you nations, bless our God!
God preserved us among the living;
But you, God, have tested us–
trapped us in a net,
let other people run right over our heads–
So I"ll enter your house
the ones my lips uttered,
I will offer the best burned offerings to you
Come close and listen,
My mouth cried out to him
If I had cherished evil in my heart,
But God definitely listened.
Bless God! He didn"t reject my prayer;

67.verse_text: Let God grant us grace and bless us; let God make his face shine on us, Selah so that your salvation becomes known among all the nations. Let all the people thank you! and shout with joy because you judge the nations fairly and guide all nations on the earth. Selah Let all the people thank you! God blesses us–our God blesses us! let the far ends of the earth honor him.
so that your way becomes known on earth,
Let the people thank you, God!
Let the people thank you, God!
The earth has yielded its harvest.
Let God continue to bless us;

68.verse_text: Let God rise up; let his enemies scatter; let those who hate him run scared before him! drive them away! Like wax melting before fire, let the wicked perish before God! and celebrate before God. Let them rejoice with gladness! Exalt the one who rides the clouds! The LORD is his name. Celebrate before him! is God in his holy habitation. but the rebellious dwell in a parched land. when you marched through the wasteland, Selah Yes, heaven poured down before God, the one from Sinai– before God, the God of Israel! when your inheritance grew weary, you restored it yourself, In your goodness, God, you provided for the poor. many messengers are bringing good news: The women back home divide the spoil. there are wings of a dove covered with silver; snow fell on Mount Zalmon. many-peaked mountain, Mount Bashan! Why do you look with envy at the mountain God desired for his dwelling, the mountain where the LORD dwells forever? countless thousands! leading away your captives, receiving tribute from people, even from those who rebel against the LORD God"s dwelling there. The God of our salvation supports us day after day! Selah and escape from certain death comes through God my LORD . the very skulls of those who walk in guilt. 'From Bashan I will bring those people back. I will bring them back from the ocean"s depths so that your dogs" tongues can lap up their share of your enemies.' the procession of my God, my king, into the sanctuary. then the musicians; between them the young women were playing hand drums: bless the LORD from Israel"s fountain!' though he"s little; then the princes of Judah, their speaker; then the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali. Show how strong you are, God, just as you"ve done for us before, where kings bring you gifts. the herd of bulls among the calves of the peoples. Trample those who delight in money; scatter the peoples who take pleasure in battles. let Cush stretch out its hands to God. Sing praises to my Lord. Selah the most ancient heaven. Look! God sends forth his voice, his mighty voice. His majesty extends over Israel; his strength is in the clouds. the God of Israel who gives strength and power to his people! Bless God!
Like smoke is driven away,
But let the righteous be glad
Sing to God! Sing praises to his name!
Father of orphans and defender of widows
God settles the lonely in their homes; he sets prisoners free with happiness, its pinions covered in precious gold.' My Lord came from Sinai into the sanctuary.
When you went forth before your people, God,
the earth shook!
You showered down abundant rain, God;
and your creatures settled in it.
My Lord gives the command–
'The kings of armies are on the run!
Even if you lie down among the sheepfolds,
When the Almighty scattered the kings there,
Mighty mountain, Mount Bashan;
You many-peaked mountain:
God"s chariots are twice ten thousand–
You ascended the heights,
Bless the Lord!
Our God is the God of salvation,
Yes, God will shatter the heads of his enemies–
My Lord has spoken:
so that you can wash your feet in their blood,
They saw your procession, God–
First came the singers,
'Bless God in the great congregation;
There"s Benjamin leading them,
Summon your strength, God!
from your temple above Jerusalem,
Rebuke the wild animals of the marshland,
Let ambassadors come from Egypt;
Sing to God, all kingdoms of the earth!
Sing to the one who rides through heaven,
Recognize how strong God is!
You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries–

69.verse_text: Save me, God, because the waters have reached my neck! My feet can"t touch the bottom! I have entered deep water; the flood has swept me up. My throat is hoarse. My eyes are exhausted with waiting for my God. are those who hate me for no reason. My treacherous enemies, those who would destroy me, are countless. Must I now give back what I didn"t steal in the first place? my wrongdoings aren"t hidden from you. don"t let those who hope in you be put to shame because of me. God of Israel!– don"t let those who seek you be disgraced because of me. Shame covers my face. an immigrant to my mother"s children. the insults of those who insult you have fallen on me! even for that I was insulted. people made fun of me. drunkards made up rude songs. at just the right time. God, in your great and faithful love, answer me with your certain salvation! Don"t let me drown! Let me be saved from those who hate me and from these watery depths! Don"t let the abyss swallow me up! Don"t let the pit close its mouth over me! Turn to me in your great compassion! because I"m in deep trouble. Answer me quickly! Redeem me! Save me because of my enemies! you know my shame and my disgrace. All my adversaries are right there in front of you. I"m sick about it. I hoped for sympathy, but there wasn"t any; I hoped for comforters, but couldn"t find any. To quench my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink. their offerings a snare. make their insides tremble constantly. let your burning fury catch them. let no one dwell in their tents. they talk about the pain of those you"ve already pierced. Don"t let them come into your righteousness! Let them not be recorded along with the righteous! I"m full of pain. Let your salvation keep me safe, God! I will magnify him with thanks more pleasing than a young bull with full horns and hooves. You who seek God– let your hearts beat strong again and doesn"t despise his captives. the oceans too, and all that moves within them! and will rebuild Judah"s cities so that God"s servants can live there and possess it. and those who love God"s name will dwell there.
I have sunk into deep mud.
I am tired of crying.
More numerous than the hairs on my head
God, you know my foolishness;
LORD God of heavenly forces!–
I am insulted because of you.
I have become a stranger to my own brothers,
Because passion for your house has consumed me,
I wept while I fasted–
When I wore funeral clothes,
Those who sit at the city gate muttered things about me;
But me? My prayer reaches you, LORD ,
Save me from the mud!
Don"t let me be swept away by the floodwaters!
Answer me, LORD , for your faithful love is good!
Don"t hide your face from me, your servant,
Come close to me!
You know full well the insults I"ve received;
Insults have broken my heart.
They gave me poison for food.
Let the table before them become a trap,
Let their eyes grow too dim to see;
Pour out your anger on them–
Let their camp be devastated;
Because they go after those you"ve already struck;
Pile guilt on top of their guilt!
Let them be wiped out of the scroll of life!
And me? I"m afflicted.
I will praise God"s name with song;
because that is more pleasing to the LORD than an ox,
Let the afflicted see it and be glad!
because the LORD listens to the needy
Let heaven and earth praise God,
God will most certainly save Zion
The offspring of God"s servants will inherit Zion,

70.verse_text: Hurry, God, to deliver me; hurry, LORD , to help me! Let them fall back and be disgraced– those people who delight in my downfall! stop because of their shameful behavior. and let those who love your saving help say again and again: 'God is great!' Hurry to me, God! You are my helper and my deliverer. Oh, LORD , don"t delay!
Let those who seek my life be ashamed and humiliated!
But let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you,
But me? I"m poor and needy.

71.verse_text: I"ve taken refuge in you, LORD . Don"t let me ever be put to shame! Bend your ear toward me and save me! where I can always escape. You commanded that my life be saved because you are my rock and my fortress. rescue me from the grip of the wrongdoer and the oppressor You, LORD , are the one I"ve trusted since childhood. you cut the cord when I came from my mother"s womb. My praise is always about you. because you are my strong refuge. glorifying you all day long. Don"t abandon me when my strength is used up! those who stalk me plot together: Pursue him! Grab him because no one will deliver him!' My God, hurry to help me! completely finished off! Let those who seek my downfall be dressed in insults and disgrace! I will add to all your praise. and your saving deeds all day long. I don"t even know how many of those there are! LORD , I will help others remember nothing but your righteous deeds. and I"m still proclaiming your wondrous deeds! don"t abandon me, God! Not until I tell generations about your mighty arm, tell all who are yet to come about your strength, because you"ve done awesome things! Who can compare to you, God? From the depths of the earth, you will raise me up one more time. and comfort me all around. I will thank you for your faithfulness, my God. I will make music for you with the lyre, holy one of Israel. because those who seek my downfall have been put to shame and disgraced.
Deliver me and rescue me by your righteousness!
Be my rock of refuge
My God, rescue me from the power of the wicked;
because you are my hope, Lord.
I"ve depended on you from birth–
I"ve become an example to many people
My mouth is filled with your praise,
Don"t cast me off in old age.
Yes, my enemies have been talking about me;
'God has abandoned him!
Don"t be far from me, God!
Let my accusers be put to shame,
But me? I will hope. Always.
My mouth will repeat your righteous acts
I will dwell on your mighty acts, my Lord.
You"ve taught me since my youth, God,
So, even in my old age with gray hair,
and about your ultimate righteousness, God,
You, who have shown me many troubles and calamities, will revive me once more. my whole being, which you saved, will do the same.
Please increase my honor
Then I"ll give you thanks with a harp–
My lips will rejoice aloud when I make music for you;
My tongue, also, will tell of your righteousness all day long,

72.verse_text: God, give your judgments to the king. Give your righteousness to the king"s son. and your poor ones with justice. let the hills bring righteousness. let him save the children of those who are needy, but let him crush oppressors! as long as the moon, generation to generation. like showers that water the earth. and let peace prosper until the moon is no more. from the river to the ends of the earth. let his enemies lick the dust. let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts. let all the nations serve him. the poor, and those who have no helper. he saves the lives of those who are in need. their blood is precious in his eyes. Let Sheba"s gold be given to him! Let him be prayed for always! Let him be blessed all day long! Let it wave on the mountaintops. Let its fruit flourish like Lebanon. Let it thrive like grass on the land. Let his name endure as long as the sun. Let all the nations be blessed through him and call him happy. the only one who does wondrous things! let his glory fill all the earth! Amen and Amen!
Let him judge your people with righteousness
Let the mountains bring peace to the people;
Let the king bring justice to people who are poor;
Let the king live as long as the sun,
Let him fall like rain upon fresh-cut grass,
Let the righteous flourish throughout their lives,
Let the king rule from sea to sea,
Let the desert dwellers bow low before him;
Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute;
Let all the kings bow down before him;
Let it be so, because he delivers the needy who cry out,
He has compassion on the weak and the needy;
He redeems their lives from oppression and violence;
Let the king live long!
Let there be abundant grain in the land.
Let the king"s name last forever.
Bless the LORD God, the God of Israel–
Bless God"s glorious name forever;
The prayers of David, Jesse"s son, are ended.

73.verse_text: Truly God is good to Israel, to those who are have a pure heart. my steps had nearly slipped I observed how the wicked are well off: their bodies are fit and strong. they aren"t weighed down like other people. why violence covers them like clothes. their hearts overflow with delusions. from their privileged positions they plan oppression. Their tongues roam the earth! Does the Most High know anything at all!' always relaxed, piling up the wealth! I"ve washed my hands to stay innocent for nothing. I"m punished every morning. I would have been unfaithful to your children. it just seemed like hard work and understood what would happen to the wicked. you will make them fall into ruin! utterly destroyed by terrors! when I was all cut up inside, I acted like nothing but an animal toward you. You held my strong hand! later you will receive me with glory. There"s nothing on earth I desire except you. but God is my heart"s rock and my share forever. you annihilate all those who are unfaithful to you. I have taken my refuge in you, my LORD God, so I can talk all about your works!
But me? My feet had almost stumbled;
because I envied the arrogant;
They suffer no pain;
They are never in trouble;
That"s why they wear arrogance like a necklace,
Their eyes bulge out from eating so well;
They scoff and talk so cruel;
Their mouths dare to speak against heaven!
That"s why people keep going back to them, keep approving what they say. when you are stirred up, you make them disappear.
And what they say is this: 'How could God possibly know!
Look at these wicked ones,
Meanwhile, I"ve kept my heart pure for no good reason;
I"m weighed down all day long.
If I said, 'I will talk about all this,'
But when I tried to understand these things,
until I entered God"s sanctuary
You will definitely put them on a slippery path;
How quickly they are devastated,
As quickly as a dream departs from someone waking up, my Lord,
When my heart was bitter,
I was stupid and ignorant.
But I was still always with you!
You have guided me with your advice;
Do I have anyone else in heaven?
My body and my heart fail,
Look! Those far from you die;
But me? It"s good for me to be near God.

74.verse_text: God, why have you abandoned us forever? Why does your anger smolder at the sheep of your own pasture? that you took as your own long ago, that you redeemed to be the tribe of your own possession– remember Mount Zion, where you dwell. to all that the enemy destroyed in the sanctuary. they set up their own signs there! they hacked down with hatchet and pick. they defiled the dwelling place of your name. They burned all of God"s meeting places in the land. No prophet is left. And none of us know how long it will last. Are enemies going to abuse your name forever? Why do you hold your strong hand close to your chest? God, who makes salvation happen in the heart of the earth! You shattered the heads of the sea monsters on the water. You gave it to the desert dwellers for food! you made strong-flowing rivers dry right up. You established both the moon and the sun. Summer and winter? You made them! how enemies have insulted you, how unbelieving fools have abused your name. Don"t forget the lives of your afflicted people forever! Because the land"s dark places are full of violence. No, let the poor and needy praise your name! Remember how unbelieving fools insult you all day long. the racket of your adversaries that never quits.
Remember your congregation
March to the unending ruins,
Your enemies roared in your own meeting place;
It looked like axes raised against a thicket of trees.
And then all its carvings
They set fire to your sanctuary, burned it to the ground;
They said in their hearts, We"ll kill all of them together!
We don"t see our own signs anymore.
How long, God, will foes insult you?
Why do you pull your hand back?
Yet God has been my king from ancient days–
You split the sea with your power.
You crushed Leviathan"s heads.
You split open springs and streams;
The day belongs to you! The night too!
You set all the boundaries of the earth in place.
So remember this, LORD :
Don"t deliver the life of your dove to wild animals!
Consider the covenant!
Don"t let the oppressed live in shame.
God, rise up! Make your case!
Don"t forget the voices of your enemies,

75.verse_text: We give thanks to you, God. Yes, we give thanks! Your name is near. Your marvelous deeds are declared. I will establish justice just so. but I will keep its pillars steady.' Selah 'Don"t be arrogant!' To the wicked I said, 'Don"t exalt your strength! doesn"t come from the east or west; it"s not from the south either. He brings this person down, but that person he lifts up. full of foaming wine, mixed with spice. He will pour it out, and all of the earth"s wicked people must drink it; they must drink every last drop! I will sing praises to Jacob"s God! 'I will demolish every bit of the wicked"s power, but the strength of the righteous will be lifted up.'
God says, 'When I decide the time is right,
The earth and all its inhabitants will melt,
Don"t exalt your strength so highly. Don"t speak so arrogantly against the rock.'
Rather it is God who is the judge.
Indeed, there"s a cup in the LORD "s hand

76.verse_text: God is known in Judah; his name is great in Israel. his habitation was Zion. the shield, the sword–even the battle itself! Selah mightier than the mountains that give food. They sank into deep lethargy. All the strong troops couldn"t even lift their hands! both chariot and horse were stopped dead-still. Who can stand before you when you are angry? The earth grew afraid and fell silent when God rose up to save all of the earth"s poor. Selah when you dress yourself Let all around him bring gifts to the awesome one. He is terrifying to all the kings of the earth.
It was there that he broke the fiery shafts of the bow,
You have announced judgment from heaven.
when God rose up to establish justice,
Even human rage will turn to your praise with whatever remains of your wrath.
Make promises to the LORD your God and keep them!
He breaks the spirit of princes.

77.verse_text: I cry out loud to God– out loud to God so that he can hear me! At night my hands are still outstretched and don"t grow numb; I complain, and my spirit grows tired. Selah I"m so upset I can"t even speak. I remember years that seem an eternity in the past. I complain, and my spirit keeps searching: Will he never be pleased again? Is his promise over for future generations? Has he angrily stopped up his compassion?' Selah that the strong hand of the Most High is different now. yes, I will remember your wondrous acts from times long past. I will ponder your deeds. Who is as great a god as you, God? you have demonstrated your strength among all peoples. redeemed the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah the waters saw you and reeled! Even the deep depths shook! the skies cracked thunder; your arrows were flying all around! lightning lit up the whole world; the earth shook and quaked. your pathways went right through the mighty waters. But your footprints left no trace! under the care of Moses and Aaron.
During the day when I"m in trouble I look for my Lord. my whole being refuses to be comforted.
I remember God and I moan.
You"ve kept my eyelids from closing.
I think about days long past;
I meditate with my heart at night;
'Will my Lord reject me forever?
Has his faithful love come to a complete end?
Has God forgotten how to be gracious?
It"s my misfortune, I thought,
But I will remember the LORD "s deeds;
I will meditate on all your works;
God, your way is holiness!
You are the God who works wonders;
With your mighty arm you redeemed your people;
The waters saw you, God–
The clouds poured water,
The crash of your thunder was in the swirling storm;
Your way went straight through the sea;
You led your people like sheep

78.verse_text: Listen, my people, to my teaching; tilt your ears toward the words of my mouth. I"ll declare riddles from days long gone– ones that our ancestors told us. we"ll tell the next generation all about the praise due the LORD and his strength– the wondrous works God has done. and set up Instruction for Israel, ordering our ancestors to teach them to their children. and children not yet born will know these things, and so they can rise up and tell their children never forgetting God"s deeds, but keeping God"s commandments– a rebellious, stubborn generation, a generation whose heart wasn"t set firm and whose spirit wasn"t faithful to God. retreated on the day of battle. they refused to walk in his Instruction. as well as the wondrous works he showed them. in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan. making the waters stand up like a wall. by the lightning all through the night. gave them plenty to drink– as if from the deep itself! made water run like rivers. rebelling against the Most High in the desert. demanded food for their stomachs. 'Can God set a dinner table in the wilderness?' they asked. and water gushed and streams flowed, but can he give bread too? Can he provide meat for his people?' A fire was ignited against Jacob; wrath also burned against Israel because they didn"t trust his saving power. opened heaven"s doors, He gave them the very grain of heaven! God sent provisions to satisfy them. and drove the south wind by his strength. he rained as many birds as the sand on the seashore! all around their dwellings. God gave them exactly what they had craved. even with the food still in their mouths! he killed the most hearty of them; he cut down Israel"s youth in their prime. and had no faith in God"s wondrous works. like a puff of air, and their years in total ruin. They would turn and earnestly search for God. that the Most High was their redeemer.
