They were lying to him with their tongues. they weren"t faithful to his covenant. kept forgiving their sins, kept avoiding destruction; he took back his anger so many times, wouldn"t stir up all his wrath! just breath that passes and doesn"t come back. and distressed him in the desert! provoking the holy one of Israel. the day when he saved them from the enemy; his marvelous works in the field of Zoan. they couldn"t drink from their own streams. frogs to destroy them. their land"s produce to locusts. their sycamore trees with frost. their herds to plagues. fury, indignation, distress, a troop of evil messengers. He didn"t save them from death, but delivered their lives over to disease. in Ham"s tents, he struck their pride and joy. guiding them like a flock in the wilderness. But the sea engulfed their enemies! to the mountain that his own strong hand had acquired. and apportioned property for them; he settled Israel"s tribes in their tents. they didn"t pay attention to his warnings. they twisted away like a defective bow. they angered him with their idols. he rejected Israel utterly. the tent where he had lived with humans. let his glory go to the enemy"s hand. he was enraged at his own possession. and his young women had no wedding songs. and his widows couldn"t even cry. as if he"d been sleeping! Like a warrior shaking off wine, he made them an everlasting disgrace. and didn"t choose the tribe of Ephraim. the mountain of Zion, which he loves. and like the earth, which he established forever. taking him from the sheepfolds. to shepherd his people Jacob, to shepherd his inheritance, Israel. he led them with the skill of his hands.
I will open my mouth with a proverb.
ones that we"ve heard and learned about,
We won"t hide them from their descendants;
He established a law for Jacob
This is so that the next generation
to put their hope in God–
and so that they won"t become like their ancestors:
The children of Ephraim, armed with bows,
They didn"t keep God"s covenant;
They forgot God"s deeds
But God performed wonders in their ancestors" presence–
God split the sea and led them through,
God led them with the cloud by day;
God split rocks open in the wilderness,
God made streams flow from the rock,
But they continued to sin against God,
They tested God in their hearts,
They spoke against God!
'True, God struck the rock
When the LORD heard this, he became furious.
because they had no faith in God,
God gave orders to the skies above,
and rained manna on them so they could eat.
Each person ate the bread of the powerful ones;
God set the east wind moving across the skies
He rained meat on them as if it were dust in the air;
God brought the birds down in the center of their camp,
So they ate and were completely satisfied;
But they didn"t stop craving–
So God"s anger came up against them:
But in spite of all that, they kept sinning
So God brought their days to an end,
But whenever God killed them, they went after him!
They would remember that God was their rock,
But they were just flattering him with lip service.
Their hearts weren"t firmly set on him;
But God, being compassionate,
God kept remembering that they were just flesh,
How often they rebelled against God in the wilderness
Time and time again they tested God,
They didn"t remember God"s power–
how God performed his signs in Egypt,
God turned their rivers into blood;
God sent swarms against them to eat them up,
God handed over their crops to caterpillars,
God killed their vines with hail,
God delivered their cattle over to disease,
God unleashed his burning anger against them–
God blazed a path for his wrath.
God struck down all of Egypt"s oldest males;
God led his own people out like sheep,
God led them in safety–they were not afraid!
God brought them to his holy territory,
God drove out the nations before them
But they tested and defied the Most High God;
They turned away, became faithless just like their ancestors;
They angered God with their many shrines;
God heard and became enraged;
God abandoned the sanctuary at Shiloh,
God let his power be held captive,
God delivered his people up to the sword;
Fire devoured his young men,
God"s priests were killed by the sword,
But then my Lord woke up–
God beat back his foes;
God rejected the tent of Joseph
Instead, he chose the tribe of Judah,
God built his sanctuary like the highest heaven
And God chose David, his servant,
God brought him from shepherding nursing ewes
David shepherded them with a heart of integrity;

79.verse_text: The nations have come into your inheritance, God! They"ve defiled your holy temple. They"ve made Jerusalem a bunch of ruins. as food for the birds; they"ve left the flesh of your faithful to the wild animals of the earth. like water all around Jerusalem, and there"s no one left to bury them. nothing but objects of ridicule and disapproval to those around us. How long will your anger burn like fire? who don"t know you, on the kingdoms that haven"t called on your name. and demolished his pasture. let your compassion hurry to meet us because we"ve been brought so low. for the glory of your name! Deliver us and cover our sins for the sake of your name! 'Where"s their God now?' Let vengeance for the spilled blood of your servants be known among the nations before our very eyes! With your powerful arm spare those who are destined to die. right where it hurts, for the insults they used on you, Lord. and the sheep of your very own pasture. We will give you thanks forever; we will proclaim your praises from one generation to the next.
They"ve poured out the blood of the faithful
We"ve become a joke to our neighbors,
How long will you rage, LORD ? Forever?
Pour out your wrath on the nations
Don"t remember the iniquities of past generations;
God of our salvation, help us
Let the prisoners" groaning reach you.
Pay back our neighbors seven times over,
We are, after all, your people

80.verse_text: Shepherd of Israel, listen! You, the one who leads Joseph as if he were a sheep. You, who are enthroned upon the winged heavenly creatures. Show yourself Wake up your power! Come to save us! Make your face shine so that we can be saved! how long will you fume against your people"s prayer? you"ve given them tears to drink three times over! our enemies make fun of us. Make your face shine so that we can be saved! You drove out the nations and planted it. then it planted its roots deep, filling the land. the mighty cedars were covered by its branches. so that all who come along can pluck its fruit, so that the bugs can feed on it? Look down from heaven and perceive it! Attend to this vine, this son whom you secured as your very own. They die at the rebuke coming from you. with the one whom you secured as your own– Revive us so that we can call on your name. Make your face shine so that we can be saved!
You"ve fed them bread made of tears;
You"ve put us at odds with our neighbors;
Restore us, God of heavenly forces!
You brought a vine out of Egypt.
You cleared the ground for it;
The mountains were covered by its shade;
It sent its branches all the way to the sea; its shoots went all the way to the Euphrates River.
So why have you now torn down its walls
so that any boar from the forest can tear it up,
Please come back, God of heavenly forces!
this root that you planted with your strong hand,
It is burned with fire. It is chopped down.
Let your hand be with the one on your right side–
then we will not turn away from you!
Restore us, LORD God of heavenly forces!

81.verse_text: Rejoice out loud to God, our strength! Shout for joy to Jacob"s God! Sweet lyre along with harp! at the full moon, for our day of celebration! this is a rule of Jacob"s God. when he went out against the land of Egypt, when I heard a language I did not yet know: your hands are free of the brick basket! I answered you in the secret of thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah If only you would listen to me, Israel. You must not bow down to any strange deity. who brought you up from Egypt"s land. Open your mouth wide–I will fill it up! Israel simply wasn"t agreeable toward me. they followed their own advice. How I wish Israel would walk in my ways! I would turn my hand against their foes. and their doom would last forever! I would satisfy you with honey from the rock.'
Take up a song and strike the drum!
Blow the horn on the new moon,
Because this is the law for Israel;
He made it a decree for Joseph
'I lifted the burden off your shoulders;
In distress you cried out, so I rescued you.
Listen, my people, I"m warning you!
There must be no foreign god among you.
I am the LORD your God,
But my people wouldn"t listen to my voice.
So I sent them off to follow their willful hearts;
How I wish my people would listen to me!
Then I would subdue their enemies in a second;
Those who hate the LORD would grovel before me,
But I would feed you with the finest wheat.

82.verse_text: God takes his stand in the divine council; he gives judgment among the gods: by granting favor to the wicked? Selah maintain the right of the poor and the destitute! Deliver them from the power of the wicked! they wander around in the dark. All the earth"s foundations shake. children of the Most High–all of you! you will fall down like any prince.' because you hold all nations in your possession!
Give justice to the lowly and the orphan;
Rescue the lowly and the needy.
They don"t know; they don"t understand;
But you will die like mortals;
Rise up, God! Judge the earth

83.verse_text: God, don"t be silent! Don"t be quiet or sit still, God, those who hate you are acting arrogantly. they plot against the people you favor. Let the name Israel be remembered no more!' they make a covenant against you. Moab and the Hagrites, Philistia along with the citizens of Tyre. they are the strong arm for Lot"s children. Selah to Sisera, and to Jabin at the Kishon River. they became fertilizer for the ground. all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna– like chaff blown by wind. just like flames set mountains ablaze, terrify them with your hurricane. Let them die in disgrace. your name is the LORD !– you alone are Most High over all the earth.
They concoct crafty plans against your own people;
'Come on,' they say, 'let"s wipe them out as a nation!
They plot with a single-minded heart;
They are the clans of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Do to them what you did to Midian,
Make their officials like Oreb and Zeeb,
those who said, 'Let"s take God"s pastures for ourselves.'
My God, make them like tumbleweeds,
Just like a fire consumes a forest,
Cover their faces with shame, LORD , so that they might seek your name.
Let them be shamed and terrified forever.

84.verse_text: How lovely is your dwelling place, LORD of heavenly forces! for the LORD "s courtyards. My heart and my body will rejoice out loud to the living God! the swallow has found herself a nest where she can lay her young beside your altars, LORD of heavenly forces, my king, my God! they praise you constantly. Selah pilgrimage is in their hearts. they make it a spring of water. Yes, the early rain covers it with blessings. hear my prayer; listen closely, Jacob"s God! Selah pay close attention to the face of your anointed one! than a thousand days anywhere else! I would prefer to stand outside the entrance of my God"s house than live comfortably in the tents of the wicked! God is favor and glory. The LORD gives–doesn"t withhold!–good things to those who walk with integrity. those who trust in you are truly happy!
My very being longs, even yearns,
Yes, the sparrow too has found a home there;
Those who live in your house are truly happy;
Those who put their strength in you are truly happy;
As they pass through the Baca Valley,
They go from strength to strength, until they see the supreme God in Zion.
Better is a single day in your courtyards
The LORD is a sun and shield;

85.verse_text: LORD , you"ve been kind to your land; you"ve changed Jacob"s circumstances for the better. you"ve covered all their sins. Selah you"ve turned away from your burning anger. Stop being angry with us! Will you prolong your anger from one generation to the next? so that your people can rejoice in you? Give us your salvation! because he speaks peace to his people and to his faithful ones. Don"t let them return to foolish ways. so that his glory can live in our land. righteousness and peace have kissed. righteousness gazes down from heaven. and our land yields its produce. making a road for his steps.
You, the God who can save us, restore us!
Will you be mad at us forever?
Won"t you bring us back to life again
Show us your faithful love, LORD !
Let me hear what the LORD God says,
God"s salvation is very close to those who honor him
Faithful love and truth have met;
Truth springs up from the ground;
Yes, the LORD gives what is good,

86.verse_text: LORD , listen closely to me and answer me, because I am poor and in need. Save your servant who trusts in you–you! My God! because I cry out to you all day long. because, my Lord, I offer my life to you, full of faithful love for all those who cry out to you. pay close attention to the sound of my requests for mercy. because you will answer me. There is nothing that can compare to your works! and bow down before you, Lord; they will glorify your name, and a wonder-worker. You are God. Just you. so that I can walk in your truth. Make my heart focused only on honoring your name. with all my heart, and I will glorify your name forever, and because you"ve rescued my life A gang of violent people want me dead. They don"t give a thought for you. are a God of compassion and mercy; you are very patient and full of faithful love. Give your servant your strength; save this child of your servant! so that those who hate me will see it and be put to shame– show a sign that you, LORD , have helped me and comforted me.
Guard my life because I am faithful.
Make your servant"s life happy again
because, my Lord, you are good and forgiving,
Listen closely to my prayer, LORD ;
Whenever I am in trouble, I cry out to you,
My Lord! There is no one like you among the gods!
All the nations that you"ve made will come
I give thanks to you, my Lord, my God,
because your faithful love toward me is awesome from the lowest part of hell.
The arrogant rise up against me, God.
Come back to me! Have mercy on me!
Show me a sign of your goodness

87.verse_text: God"s foundation is set on the holy mountains. more than all of Jacob"s houses combined. the city of God! Selah also Philistia and Tyre, along with Cush– each of these was born there. 'Each person was born in it, but the one who will establish it is the Most High.' 'Each one was born there.' Selah 'The source of my life comes from you.'
Glorious things are said about you,
I count Rahab and Babel among those who know me;
And of Zion it is said:
The LORD makes a record as he registers the peoples:
And while they dance, people sing:

88.verse_text: LORD , God of my salvation, by day I cry out, even at night, before you– Turn your ear to my outcry I am like those who are beyond help, lying in the grave, like dead bodies– those you don"t remember anymore, those who are cut off from your power. in places dark and deep. you subdue me with it, wave after wave. Selah You"ve made me disgusting to them. I can"t escape. I"m trapped! I"ve been calling out to you every day, LORD – I"ve had my hands outstretched to you! Do ghosts rise up and give you thanks? Selah your righteousness in the land of oblivion? My prayer meets you first thing in the morning! Why do you hide your face from me? I"ve endured your terrors. I"m lifeless. your terrors have destroyed me. they engulf me completely. My only friend is darkness.
because my whole being is filled with distress; my life is at the very brink of hell. your faithfulness in the underworld?
I am considered as one of those plummeting into the pit.
You placed me down in the deepest pit,
My eyes are tired of looking at my suffering.
Do you work wonders for the dead?
Is your faithful love proclaimed in the grave,
Are your wonders known in the land of darkness,
But I cry out to you, LORD !
Why do you reject my very being, LORD ?
Since I was young I"ve been afflicted, I"ve been dying.
Your fiery anger has overwhelmed me;
They surround me all day long like water;
You"ve made my loved ones and companions distant.

89.verse_text: I will sing of the LORD "s loyal love forever. I will proclaim your faithfulness with my own mouth from one generation to the next. You establish your faithfulness in heaven.' I promised my servant David: I will build up your throne from one generation to the next."' Selah for your faithfulness too– in the assembly of the holy ones. Who among the gods is equal to the LORD ? God is awesome and revered more than all those around him. Mighty LORD , your faithfulness surrounds you! When its waves rise up, it"s you who makes them still. you scattered your enemies with your strong arm. The world and all that fills it– you made all of it! North and south–you created them! shout praises to your name. your hand is strong; your strong hand is raised high! loyal love and faithfulness stand in front of you. They walk in the light of your presence, LORD ! and are uplifted by your righteousness By your favor you make us strong our king belongs to the holy one of Israel! to your faithful servants: I placed a crown on a strong man. I raised up someone specially chosen from the people. I anointed him with my holy oil. yes, my arm will strengthen him! no wicked person will make him suffer. I will strike down all those who hate him. He will be strengthened by my name. I will set his strong hand on the rivers. 'You are my father, my God, the rock of my salvation.' I"ll make him the high king of all earth"s kings. My covenant with him will last forever. His throne will last as long as heaven does. stop following my rules– stop keeping my commandments– and I will punish their wrongdoing with a severe beating. I won"t betray my faithfulness. I won"t renege on what crossed my lips. I will not lie to David. His throne will be like the sun, always before me. like the moon, a faithful witness in the sky. Selah You"ve become infuriated with your anointed one. You"ve thrown his crown in the dirt. You"ve made his strongholds a pile of ruins. He"s nothing but a joke to his neighbors. You gave all his enemies reason to celebrate. and didn"t support him in battle. You"ve thrown his throne to the ground. You"ve wrapped him up in shame. Selah Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your wrath burn like fire? Have you created humans for no good reason? from long ago, my Lord– the same ones you promised to David by your own faithfulness? Remember how I bear in my heart the ones they use to abuse every step your anointed one takes. Amen and Amen!
That"s why I say, 'Your loyal love is rightly built–forever! Who is ever rescued from the grip of the grave? Selah all the insults of the nations,
You said, 'I made a covenant with my chosen one;
"I will establish your offspring forever;
Heaven thanks you for your wondrous acts, LORD –
Is there any in the sky who could compare to the LORD ?
God is respected in the council of the holy ones;
Who is like you, LORD God of heavenly forces?
You rule over the surging sea:
It"s you who crushed Rahab like a dead body;
Heaven is yours! The earth too!
The mountains Tabor and Hermon
You have a powerful arm;
Your throne is built on righteousness and justice;
The people who know the celebratory shout are truly happy!
They rejoice in your name all day long
because you are the splendor of their strength.
because our shield is the LORD "s own;
Once you spoke in a vision
I discovered my servant David.
My hand will sustain him–
No enemy will oppress him;
I will crush all his foes in front of him.
My faithfulness and my loyal love will be with him.
I will set his hand on the sea.
He will cry out to me:
Yes, I"ll make him the one born first–
I will always guard my loyal love toward him.
I will establish his dynasty for all time.
But if his children ever abandon my Instruction,
if they treat my statutes like dirt,
then I will punish their sin with a stick,
But even then I won"t withdraw my loyal love from him.
I won"t break my covenant.
By my own holiness I"ve sworn one thing:
His dynasty will last forever.
It will be securely established forever;
But you, God, have rejected and despised him.
You"ve canceled the covenant with your servant.
You"ve broken through all his walls.
All those who pass by plunder him.
You lifted high his foes" strong hand.
Yes, you dulled the edge of his sword
You"ve put an end to his splendor.
You"ve shortened the prime of his life.
How long will it last, LORD ?
Remember how short my life is!
Who lives their life without seeing death?
Where now are your loving acts
Remember your servant"s abuse, my Lord!
the ones your enemies, LORD , use–
Bless the LORD forever!

90.verse_text: Lord, you have been our help, generation after generation. before you birthed the earth and the inhabited world– from forever in the past to forever in the future, you are God. saying, 'Go back, humans,' are like yesterday past, like a short period during the night watch. like grass that is renewed in the morning. but come evening it withers, all dried up. we are paralyzed with fear on account of your rage. set our hidden faults in the light from your face. we finish up our years with a whimper. maybe eighty, if we"re strong. But their duration brings hard work and trouble because they go by so quickly. And then we fly off. The honor that is due you corresponds to your wrath. so we can have a wise heart. Please, quick! Have some compassion for your servants! so we can rejoice and celebrate our whole life long. for the same number of years that we saw only trouble. let your glory be seen by their children. Make the work of our hands last. Make the work of our hands last!
because in your perspective a thousand years
You sweep humans away like a dream,
True, in the morning it thrives, renewed,
Yes, we are wasting away because of your wrath;
You put our sins right in front of you,
Yes, all our days slip away because of your fury;
We live at best to be seventy years old,
Who can comprehend the power of your anger?
Teach us to number our days
Fill us full every morning with your faithful love
Make us happy for the same amount of time that you afflicted us–
Let your acts be seen by your servants;
Let the kindness of the Lord our God be over us.

91.verse_text: Living in the Most High"s shelter, camping in the Almighty"s shade, You are my God–the one I trust!' and from deadly sickness. you"ll find refuge under his wings. His faithfulness is a protective shield. arrows that fly in daylight, destruction that ravages at noontime. ten thousand right beside you– it won"t happen to you. and you will see the wicked punished. the Most High, your place of residence– no disease will come close to your tent. to protect you wherever you go. so you don"t bruise your foot on a stone. you"ll trample young lions and serpents underfoot. I"ll rescue you. I"ll protect you because you know my name. I"ll be with you in troubling times. I"ll save you and glorify you. I"ll show you my salvation.'
I say to the LORD , 'You are my refuge, my stronghold!
God will save you from the hunter"s trap
God will protect you with his pinions;
Don"t be afraid of terrors at night,
or sickness that prowls in the dark,
Even if one thousand people fall dead next to you,
Because you"ve made the LORD my refuge,
no evil will happen to you;
Because he will order his messengers to help you,
They will carry you with their own hands
You"ll march on top of lions and vipers;
God says, 'Because you are devoted to me,
Whenever you cry out to me, I"ll answer.
I"ll fill you full with old age.

92.verse_text: It is good to give thanks to the LORD , to sing praises to your name, Most High; your faithfulness at nighttime with the melody of the lyre by your acts. I sing with joy because of your handiwork. Your thoughts are so deep! fools don"t understand this: and all evildoers seem to blossom, they do so only to be destroyed forever. Look at how your enemies die, how all evildoers are scattered abroad! I"m soaked in precious ointment. my ears have heard the downfall of my evil foes. They will grow strong like a cedar of Lebanon. will spring up in the courtyards of our God. they will remain lush and fresh 'The LORD is righteous. He"s my rock. There"s nothing unrighteous in him.'
to proclaim your loyal love in the morning,
because you"ve made me happy, LORD ,
How awesome are your works, LORD !
though the wicked spring up like grass
But you, LORD , are exalted forever!
But you"ve made me as strong as a wild ox.
My eyes have seen my enemies" defeat;
The righteous will spring up like a palm tree.
Those who have been replanted in the LORD "s house
They will bear fruit even when old and gray;

93.verse_text: The LORD rules! He is robed in majesty– the LORD is robed, clothed with strength. it won"t be shaken. You are eternal! the floods have raised up their voices; the floods raise up a roar! mightier than the sea"s waves, mighty on high is the LORD ! Holiness decorates your house, LORD , for all time. Yes, he set the world firmly in place;
Your throne is set firm for a very long time.
LORD , the floods have raised up–
But mightier than the sound of much water,

94.verse_text: LORD , avenging God– avenging God, show yourself! Pay back the arrogant exactly what they deserve! how long will the wicked win? all the evildoers are bragging. They abuse your very own possession. they murder orphans, 'The LORD can"t see it; Jacob"s God doesn"t know what"s going on!' You fools–when will you get some sense? can"t he hear? The one who formed the eye, can"t he see? can"t he punish? The one who teaches humans, knows that they are nothing but a puff of air. the ones you teach from your Instruction– until a pit is dug for the wicked. he will not abandon his very own possession. and all whose heart is right will follow after. Who will help me against evildoers? your faithful love steadies me, LORD . your comforting calms me down. one who wreaks havoc by means of the law? They condemn innocent blood. my God is my rock of refuge. completely destroy them because of their evil. Yes, the LORD our God will completely destroy them.
Rise up, judge of the earth!
How long will the wicked–oh, LORD !–
They spew arrogant words;
They crush your own people, LORD !
They kill widows and immigrants;
saying all the while,
You ignorant people better learn quickly.
The one who made the ear,
The one who disciplines nations, doesn"t he know? I would live instantly in total silence.
The LORD does indeed know human thoughts,
The people you discipline, LORD , are truly happy–
giving them relief from troubling times
The LORD will not reject his people;
No, but justice will once again meet up with righteousness,
Who will stand up for me against the wicked?
If the LORD hadn"t helped me,
Whenever I feel my foot slipping,
When my anxieties multiply,
Can a wicked ruler be your ally;
The wicked gang up against the lives of the righteous.
But the LORD is my fortress;
He will repay them for their wickedness,

95.verse_text: Come, let"s sing out loud to the LORD ! Let"s raise a joyful shout to the rock of our salvation! Let"s shout songs of joy to him! the great king over all other gods. the mountain heights belong to him; along with the dry ground, which his own hands formed. Let"s kneel before the LORD , our maker! and we are the people of his pasture, the sheep in his hands. If only you would listen to his voice right now! like you did at Meribah, like you did when you were at Massah, in the wilderness, and scrutinized me, even though they had already seen my acts. I said, "These people have twisted hearts. They don"t know my ways." "They will never enter my place of rest!"'
Let"s come before him with thanks!
The LORD is a great God,
The earth"s depths are in his hands;
the sea, which he made, is his
Come, let"s worship and bow down!
For forty years I despised that generation;

96.verse_text: Sing to the LORD a new song! Sing to the LORD , all the earth! Share the news of his saving work every single day! declare his wondrous works among all people He is awesome beyond all other gods but it is the LORD who created heaven! strength and beauty are in his sanctuary. give to the LORD glory and power! Bring gifts! Enter his courtyards! Tremble before him, all the earth! it won"t be shaken. He will judge all people fairly.' Let the sea and everything in it roar! Then all the trees of the forest too will shout out joyfully He is coming to establish justice on the earth! He will establish justice in the world rightly. He will establish justice among all people fairly.
Sing to the LORD ! Bless his name!
Declare God"s glory among the nations;
because the LORD is great and so worthy of praise.
because all the gods of the nations are just idols,
Greatness and grandeur are in front of him;
Give to the LORD , all families of the nations–
Give to the LORD the glory due his name!
Bow down to the LORD in his holy splendor!
Tell the nations, 'The LORD rules! Yes, he set the world firmly in place;
Let heaven celebrate! Let the earth rejoice!
Let the countryside and everything in it celebrate!
before the LORD because he is coming!

97.verse_text: The LORD rules! Let the earth rejoice! Let all the islands celebrate! His throne is built on righteousness and justice. burning up his enemies on every side. the earth sees it and trembles! before the Lord of the whole world! and all nations have seen his glory. those who are proud of idols, are put to shame. All gods bow down to the Lord! because of your acts of justice, LORD , over all the earth, because you are so superior to all other gods. God guards the lives of his faithful ones, delivering them from the power of the wicked. joy too for those whose heart is right. Give thanks to his holy name!
Clouds and thick darkness surround God.
His lightning lights up the world;
The mountains melt like wax before the LORD ,
Zion has heard and celebrates, the towns of Judah rejoice,
because you, LORD , are the Most High
Those of you who love the LORD , hate evil!
Light is planted like seed for the righteous person;
Rejoice in the LORD , righteous ones!

98.verse_text: Sing to the LORD a new song because he has done wonderful things! His own strong hand and his own holy arm have won the victory! he has revealed his righteousness in the eyes of all the nations. and faithfulness to the house of Israel; every corner of the earth has seen our God"s salvation. Be happy! Rejoice out loud! Sing your praises! with the lyre and the sound of music. shout triumphantly before the LORD , the king! the world and all its inhabitants too. let the mountains rejoice out loud altogether because he is coming to establish justice on the earth! He will establish justice in the world rightly; he will establish justice among all people fairly.
The LORD has made his salvation widely known;
God has remembered his loyal love
Shout triumphantly to the LORD , all the earth!
Sing your praises to the LORD with the lyre–
With trumpets and a horn blast,
Let the sea and everything in it roar;
Let all the rivers clap their hands;

99.verse_text: The LORD rules– the nations shake! He sits enthroned on the winged heavenly creatures– the earth quakes! he is exalted over all the nations. He is holy! you are the one who established what is fair. You worked justice and righteousness in Jacob. Bow low at his footstool! He is holy! Samuel too among those who called on his name. They cried out to the LORD , and he himself answered them– They kept the laws and the rules God gave to them. To them you were a God who forgives but also the one who avenged their wrong deeds. Bow low at his holy mountain because the LORD our God is holy!
The LORD is great in Zion;
Let them thank your great and awesome name.
Moses and Aaron were among his priests,
he spoke to them from a pillar of cloud.
LORD our God, you answered them.

100.verse_text: Shout triumphantly to the LORD , all the earth! Come before him with shouts of joy! We are his people, the sheep of his own pasture. enter his courtyards with praise! Thank him! Bless his name! his loyal love lasts forever; his faithfulness lasts generation after generation.
Know that the LORD is God– he made us; we belong to him.

101.verse_text: Oh, let me sing about faithful love and justice! I want to sing my praises to you, LORD ! how long before it gets here? I will walk with a heart of integrity in my own house. I hate wrongdoing; none of that will stick to me. I won"t be familiar with evil. who secretly tells lies about a neighbor. I can"t stomach anyone who has proud eyes or an arrogant heart. who are faithful in the land, to have them close to me. The person who walks without blame will work for me. won"t stay in my house. The person who tells lies won"t last for long before me. all those who are wicked in the land in order to eliminate all evildoers from the LORD "s city.
I want to study the way of integrity–
I won"t set my eyes on anything worthless.
A corrupt heart will be far from me.
But the person who acts deceitfully

102.verse_text: LORD , hear my prayer! Let my cry reach you! in my time of trouble! Listen to me! Answer me quickly as I cry out! my bones are burned up as if in an oven; I even forget to eat my food My bones are protruding from my skin. like some screech owl in the desert. I"m all alone like a bird on a roof. those who mock me curse using my name! I"ve been mixing tears into my drinks because you picked me up and threw me away. I"m dried up like dead grass. Your fame lasts from one generation to the next! you"ll have compassion on Zion because it is time to have mercy on her– the time set for that has now come! they show mercy even to her dirt. all the earth"s rulers will honor your glory he will be seen there in his glory. he won"t despise their prayers. so that people not yet created will praise the LORD : surveyed the earth from heaven, to set free those condemned to death, and his praise declared in Jerusalem, all kingdoms–to serve the LORD . cutting my days short. your years go on from one generation to the next! the skies are your handiwork. All of these things will wear out like clothing; you change them like clothes, and they pass on. Your years never end! let your servants" descendants live secure in your presence.'
Don"t hide your face from me
Because my days disappear like smoke,
my heart is smashed like dried-up grass.
because of my intense groans.
I"m like some wild owl–
I lie awake all night.
All day long my enemies make fun of me;
I"ve been eating ashes instead of bread.
because of your anger and wrath,
My days are like a shadow soon gone.
But you, LORD , rule forever!
You will stand up–
Your servants cherish Zion"s stones;
The nations will honor the LORD "s name;
because the LORD will rebuild Zion;
God will turn to the prayer of the impoverished;
Let this be written down for the next generation
The LORD looked down from his holy summit,
to hear the prisoners" groans,
that the LORD "s name may be declared in Zion
when all people are gathered together–
God broke my strength in midstride,
I said, 'My God, don"t take me away in the prime of life–
You laid the earth"s foundations long ago;
These things will pass away, but you will last.
But you are the one!
Let your servants" children live safe;

103.verse_text: Let my whole being bless the LORD ! Let everything inside me bless his holy name! and never forget all his good deeds: heals all your sickness, crowns you with faithful love and compassion, so that your youth is made fresh like an eagle"s. does justice for all who are oppressed. made his deeds known to the Israelites. very patient, and full of faithful love. he won"t be angry forever. or repay us according to our wrongdoing, that"s how large God"s faithful love is for those who honor him. that"s how far God has removed our sin from us. that"s how the LORD feels compassion for those who honor him. God remembers we"re just dust. they bloom like a wildflower; even the ground where it stood doesn"t remember it. for those who honor him. And God"s righteousness reaches to the grandchildren and remember to keep his commands. and his kingdom rules over all. bless the LORD ! You who are mighty in power and keep his word, who obey everything he says, bless him! bless the LORD ! All you who serve him and do his will, bless him! bless the LORD ! Everywhere, throughout his kingdom, let my whole being bless the LORD !
Let my whole being bless the LORD
how God forgives all your sins,
saves your life from the pit,
and satisfies you with plenty of good things
The LORD works righteousness;
God made his ways known to Moses;
The LORD is compassionate and merciful,
God won"t always play the judge;
He doesn"t deal with us according to our sin
because as high as heaven is above the earth,
As far as east is from west–
Like a parent feels compassion for their children–
Because God knows how we"re made,
The days of a human life are like grass:
but when the wind blows through it, it"s gone;
But the LORD "s faithful love is from forever ago to forever from now
of those who keep his covenant
The LORD has established his throne in heaven,
You divine messengers,
All you heavenly forces,
All God"s creatures,

104.verse_text: Let my whole being bless the LORD ! LORD my God, how fantastic you are! You are clothed in glory and grandeur! you open the skies like a curtain. you make the clouds your chariot, going around on the wings of the wind. you make fire and flame your ministers. so that it will never ever fall. the waters were higher than the mountains! they fled in fear at the sound of your thunder. streaming down the valleys to the place you established for them. so they"ll never again cover the earth. They flow between the mountains, the wild donkeys quench their thirst. chirping loudly in the trees. The earth is filled full by the fruit of what you"ve done. you make plants for human farming in order to get food from the ground, along with oil, which makes the face shine, and bread, which sustains the human heart. the cedars of Lebanon, which God planted, where the stork has a home in the cypresses. the ridges are the refuge of badgers. and the sun too, which knows when to set. when every forest animal prowls. seeking their food from God. and lie down in their dens. to do their work until evening. You made them all so wisely! The earth is full of your creations! with its countless creatures– living things both small and large. and Leviathan, which you made, plays in it! to give them their food on time. when you open your hand, they are filled completely full! when you take away their breath, they die and return to dust. and you make the surface of the ground brand-new again. Let the LORD rejoice in all he has made! God just touches the mountains, and they erupt in smoke. I will sing praises to my God while I"m still alive. I"m rejoicing in the LORD ! let the wicked be no more. But let my whole being bless the LORD ! Praise the LORD !
You wear light like a robe;
You build your lofty house on the waters;
You make the winds your messengers;
You established the earth on its foundations
You covered it with the watery deep like a piece of clothing;
But at your rebuke they ran away;
They flowed over the mountains,
You set a boundary they cannot cross
You put gushing springs into dry riverbeds.
providing water for every wild animal–
Overhead, the birds in the sky make their home,
From your lofty house, you water the mountains.
You make grass grow for cattle;
and wine, which cheers people"s hearts,
The LORD "s trees are well watered–
where the birds make their nests,
The high mountains belong to the mountain goats;
God made the moon for the seasons,
You bring on the darkness and it is night,
The young lions roar for their prey,
When the sun rises, they gather together
Then people go off to their work,
LORD , you have done so many things!
And then there"s the sea, wide and deep,
There go the ships on it,
All your creations wait for you
When you give it to them, they gather it up;
But when you hide your face, they are terrified;
When you let loose your breath, they are created,
Let the LORD "s glory last forever!
He has only to look at the earth, and it shakes.
I will sing to the LORD as long as I live;
Let my praise be pleasing to him;
Let sinners be wiped clean from the earth;

105.verse_text: Give thanks to the LORD ; call upon his name; make his deeds known to all people! sing praises to the Lord; dwell on all his wondrous works! Let the hearts rejoice of all those seeking the LORD ! seek his face always! all his marvelous works, and the justice he declared– and the children of Jacob, his chosen ones. His justice is everywhere throughout the whole world. the word he commanded to a thousand generations, the solemn pledge he swore to Isaac. as an eternal covenant for Israel, as your allotted inheritance.' insignificant, just immigrants– from one kingdom to the next, God punished kings for their sake: don"t harm my prophets!' destroying every source of food, who was sold as a slave: it was Joseph. his neck was in an iron collar, the ruler of many people released him. and to teach wisdom to his advisors. how Jacob became an immigrant in the land of Ham. more powerful than their enemies, and dealt shrewdly with his servants. and the one he chose, Aaron. his marvelous works on the land of Ham. but the Egyptians rejected his word. and killed their fish. even in the bedrooms of their king! gnats throughout their whole country! along with lightning flashes throughout their land. shattered the trees of their countryside. countless grasshoppers came! they devoured the fruit of their soil. struck down their very pride and joy. not one of its tribes stumbled. because the dread of Israel had come upon them. gave lightning to provide light at night. God filled them full with food from heaven. flowing like a river through the desert! to Abraham his servant, his chosen ones with songs of joy. they inherited the wealth of many peoples– and observe his instructions. Praise the LORD !
Sing to God;
Give praise to God"s holy name!
Pursue the LORD and his strength;
Remember the wondrous works he has done,
you who are the offspring of Abraham, his servant,
The LORD –he is our God.
God remembers his covenant forever,
which he made with Abraham,
God set it up as binding law for Jacob,
promising, 'I hereby give you the land of Canaan
When they were few in number–
wandering from nation to nation,
God didn"t let anyone oppress them.
'Don"t touch my anointed ones;
When God called for a famine in the land,
he sent a man ahead of them,
Joseph"s feet hurt in his shackles;
until what he predicted actually happened, until what the LORD had said proved him true.
The king sent for Joseph and set him free;
The king made Joseph master of his house and ruler over everything he owned,
to make sure his princes acted according to his will,
That"s how Israel came to Egypt,
God made his people very fruitful,
whose hearts God changed so they hated his people
God sent Moses his servant
They put God"s signs on Egypt,
God sent darkness, and it became dark,
God turned their waters into blood
God made their land swarm with frogs –
God spoke, and the insects came–
God turned their rain into hail
God destroyed their vines and their fig trees;
God spoke, and the locusts came–
They devoured all the plants in their land;
God struck down all the oldest sons throughout their land;
Then God brought Israel out, filled with silver and gold;
Egypt celebrated when they left,
God spread out clouds as a covering;
The people asked, and God brought quail;
God opened the rock and out gushed water–
Because God remembered his holy promise
God brought his people out with rejoicing,
God gave them the lands of other nations;
all so that they would keep his laws

106.verse_text: Praise the LORD ! Give thanks to the LORD because he is good, because his faithful love endures forever. or publicly recount all his praise? who always do what is right, are truly happy! Visit me with your saving help so I can rejoice in the joy of your nation, so I can praise along with your possession. We"ve done what is wrong. We"ve acted wickedly. They didn"t remember how much faithful love you have. to make known his mighty power. he led them through the deeps like they were a dry desert. he redeemed them from the power of the enemy. not one of them survived! they sang God"s praise. They wouldn"t wait for his advice. they tested God in the wastelands. jealous too of Aaron, the LORD "s holy one. and covering over Abiram"s crowd. flames burned up the wicked. bowing down to a metal idol. for an image of a bull that eats grass. the one who had done great things in Egypt, awesome deeds at the Reed Sea. except for the fact that Moses, his chosen one, stood in the way, right in front of him, and turned God"s destructive anger away. They didn"t trust God"s promise. and wouldn"t listen to the LORD "s voice. making them fall in the desert, casting them across many lands. and ate sacrifices offered to the dead. so a plague broke out against them. and the plague was contained. generation after generation, forever. and things went badly for Moses because of them, so that he spoke rashly with his lips. as the LORD had ordered them to do. learning what they did which became a trap for them. the blood of their own sons and daughters– the ones they sacrificed to Canaan"s false gods– so the land was defiled by the bloodshed. he despised his own possession. people who hated them ruled over them. and they were humbled under their power. but they were determined to rebel, and so they were brought down by their own sin. when he heard their loud cries. and because of how much faithful love he has, God changed his mind. from all their captors. Who could possibly repeat all of the LORD "s mighty acts
The people who uphold justice,
Remember me, LORD , with the favor you show your people.
so I can experience the good things your chosen ones experience,
We have sinned–right along with our ancestors.
Our ancestors in Egypt didn"t understand your wondrous works. So they rebelled by the sea–at the Reed Sea. he sent food to satisfy their appetites.
But God saved them for the sake of his good name,
God scolded the Reed Sea, and it dried right up;
God saved them from hostile powers;
But the waters covered over their foes–
So our ancestors trusted God"s words;
But how quickly they forgot what he had done!
They were overcome with craving in the desert;
God gave them what they asked for;
But then they were jealous of Moses in the camp,
So the earth opened up, swallowing Dathan,
Fire blazed throughout that whole group;
They made a calf at Horeb,
They traded their glorious God
They forgot the God who saved them–
wondrous works in the land of Ham,

But then they rejected the land that was so desirable.
They muttered in their tents
So God raised his hand against them,
scattering their offspring among the nations,
They joined themselves to Baal-peor
They made God angry by what they did,
Then Phinehas stood up and prayed,
That"s why Phinehas is considered righteous,
But they angered God at Meribah"s waters,
because they made him bitter
They didn"t destroy the nations
Instead, they got mixed up with the nations,
and serving those false gods,
They sacrificed their own sons and daughters to demons!
They shed innocent blood,
They made themselves unclean by what they did; they prostituted themselves by their actions.
So the LORD "s anger burned against his people;
God handed them over to the nations;
Their enemies oppressed them,
God delivered them numerous times,
But God saw their distress
God remembered his covenant for their sake,
God allowed them to receive compassion
LORD our God, save us!
Bless the LORD , the God of Israel,

107.verse_text: 'Give thanks to the LORD because he is good, because his faithful love lasts forever!' the ones God redeemed from the power of their enemies, from east and west, north and south. They couldn"t find their way to a city or town. their lives were slipping away. and God delivered them from their desperate circumstances. and his wondrous works for all people, and he filled up the hungry with good things! they were prisoners suffering in chains and rejected the Most High"s plans. They stumbled, and there was no one to help them. and God saved them from their desperate circumstances. he shattered their chains. and his wondrous works for all people, and split iron bars in two! They suffered because of their wickedness. they had arrived at death"s gates. and God saved them from their desperate circumstances. he rescued them from their pit. and his wondrous works for all people. and declare what God has done in songs of joy! making their living on the high seas. they saw his wondrous works in the depths of the sea. that brought the waves up high. they crashed down to the depths. The sailors" courage melted at this terrible situation. None of their skill was of any help. and God brought them out safe from their desperate circumstances. the sea"s waves were hushed. then God led them to the harbor they were hoping for. and his wondrous works for all people. and praise God in the assembly of the elders. watery springs into thirsty ground, when its inhabitants are wicked. thirsty ground into watery springs, They even build a city and live there! and obtain a fruitful harvest. God won"t even let their cattle diminish. when they"re brought down by oppression, trouble, and grief– making them wander aimlessly in the wastelands. he makes their families as numerous as sheep! but every wicked person shuts their mouth. carefully considering the LORD "s faithful love.
That"s what those who are redeemed by the LORD say,
the ones God gathered from various countries,
Some of the redeemed had wandered into the desert, into the wasteland.
They were hungry and thirsty;
So they cried out to the LORD in their distress,
God led them straight to human habitation.
Let them thank the LORD for his faithful love
because God satisfied the one who was parched with thirst,
Some of the redeemed had been sitting in darkness and deep gloom;
because they had disobeyed God"s instructions
So God humbled them with hard work.
So they cried out to the LORD in their distress,
God brought them out from the darkness and deep gloom;
Let them thank the LORD for his faithful love
because God has shattered bronze doors
Some of the redeemed were fools because of their sinful ways.
They had absolutely no appetite for food;
So they cried out to the LORD in their distress,
God gave the order and healed them;
Let them thank the LORD for his faithful love
Let them offer thanksgiving sacrifices
Some of the redeemed had gone out on the ocean in ships,
They saw what the LORD had made;
God spoke and stirred up a storm
The waves went as high as the sky;
They staggered and stumbled around like they were drunk.
So they cried out to the LORD in their distress,
God quieted the storm to a whisper;
So they rejoiced because the waves had calmed down;
Let them thank the LORD for his faithful love
Let them exalt God in the congregation of the people
God turns rivers into desert,
fruitful land into unproductive dirt,
But God can also turn the desert into watery pools,
where he settles the hungry.
They plant fields and vineyards
God blesses them, and they become many.
But when they do diminish–
God pours contempt on their leaders,
But God raises the needy from their suffering;
Those who do right see it and celebrate,
Whoever is wise will pay attention to these things,

108.verse_text: My heart is unwavering, God. I will sing and make music– yes, with my whole being! I will wake the dawn itself! I will make music to you among the nations, your faithfulness reaches the clouds. Let your glory be over all the earth! so that the people you love might be rescued. 'I will celebrate as I divide up Shechem and portion out the Succoth Valley. Ephraim is my helmet, Judah is my scepter. I"ll throw my shoe at Edom. I shout in triumph over Philistia! I wish someone would lead me to Edom!' You, God, no longer accompany our armies. human help is worthless. God is the one who will trample our adversaries.
I will give thanks to you, LORD , among all the peoples;
because your faithful love is higher than heaven;
Exalt yourself, God, higher than heaven!
Save me by your power and answer me
God has spoken in his sanctuary:
Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine;
I wish someone would bring me to a fortified city!
But you have rejected us, God, haven"t you?
Give us help against the enemy–

109.verse_text: God of my praise, don"t keep quiet, have opened up against me, talking about me with lying tongues. they attack me for no reason. but I am at prayer. hatred in return for my love. 'an accuser to stand right next to him. let his prayer be found sinful! let someone else assume his position. let his wife turn into a widow. driven out of their ruined homes. let strangers plunder his wealth. let no one have mercy on his orphans. let their names be wiped out in just one generation! let his mother"s sin never be wiped out. and let God eliminate the very memory of them from the land. but chased after the poor and needy– even the brokenhearted–with deadly intent! let it come back on him! Since he didn"t care much for blessing, let it be far away from him! let them seep inside him like water, seep into his bones like oil! like a belt that is always around him.' the reward for those who speak evil against me! act on my behalf for the sake of your name; deliver me because your faithful love is so good; and my heart is broken. I"m shaken off, like some locust. my body is skin and bones. when they see me, they just shake their heads. Save me according to your faithful love! that you have done it, LORD ! If they rise up, let them be disgraced, but let your servant celebrate! let them wear their disgrace like a coat. among a great crowd I will praise God! to save them from any who would condemn them.
because the mouths of wicked liars
Hateful words surround me;
Instead of returning my love, they accuse me–
They repay me evil for good,
'Appoint a wicked person to be against this person,' they say,
When the sentence is passed, let him be found guilty–
Let his days be few;
Let his children become orphans;
Let his children wander aimlessly, begging,
Let a creditor seize everything he owns;
Let no one extend faithful love to him;
Let his descendants be eliminated;
Let his father"s wrongdoing be remembered before the LORD ;
Let them be before the LORD always,
All because this person didn"t remember to demonstrate faithful love,
Since he loved to curse,
Since he wore curses like a coat,
Let them be like the clothes he wears,
But let all that be the reward my accusers get from the LORD ,
But you, LORD , my Lord!–
because I am poor and needy,
Like a lengthening shadow, I"m passing away;
My legs are weak from fasting;
I"ve become a joke to my accusers;
Help me, LORD my God!
And let them know that this is by your hand–
Let them curse–but you, bless me!
Let my accusers be dressed in shame;
But I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth;
Because God stands right next to the needy,

110.verse_text: What the LORD says to my master: 'Sit right beside me until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet!' reach far from Zion! Rule over your enemies! on your day of battle. My master, by your strong hand,

111.verse_text: Praise the LORD ! I thank the LORD with all my heart in the company of those who do right, in the congregation. they are treasured by all who desire them. God"s righteousness stands forever. The LORD is full of mercy and compassion. God remembers his covenant forever. and gave them what had belonged to other nations. all God"s rules are trustworthy– they are fulfilled with truth and right doing. God commanded that his covenant last forever. Holy and awesome is God"s name! sure knowledge is for all who keep God"s laws. God"s praise lasts forever!
The works of the LORD are magnificent;
God"s deeds are majestic and glorious.
God is famous for his wondrous works.
God gives food to those who honor him.
God proclaimed his powerful deeds to his people
God"s handiwork is honesty and justice;
they are established always and forever:
God sent redemption for his people;
Fear of the LORD is where wisdom begins;

112.verse_text: Praise the LORD ! Those who honor the LORD , who adore God"s commandments, are truly happy! The offspring of those who do right will be blessed; Their righteousness stands forever. They are merciful, compassionate, and righteous. as are those who conduct their affairs with justice. the righteous will be remembered forever! Their hearts are steady, trusting in the LORD . In the end, they will witness their enemies" defeat. Their righteousness stands forever. Their strength increases gloriously. they grind their teeth, but disappear to nothing. What the wicked want to see happen comes to nothing!
Their descendants will be strong throughout the land.
wealth and riches will be in their houses.
They shine in the dark for others who do right.
Those who lend generously are good people–
Yes, these sorts of people will never be shaken;
They won"t be frightened at bad news.
Their hearts are firm; they aren"t afraid.
They give freely to those in need.
The wicked see all this and fume;

113.verse_text: Praise the LORD ! You who serve the LORD –praise! Praise the LORD "s name! from now until forever from now! let the LORD "s name be praised! God"s glory is higher than the skies! God rules from on high; and raises up the needy from the garbage pile with the leaders of his own people! now a joyful mother with children! Praise the LORD !
Let the LORD "s name be blessed
The LORD is high over all the nations;
Who could possibly compare to the LORD our God?
he has to come down to even see heaven and earth!
God lifts up the poor from the dirt
God nests the once barren woman at home–

114.verse_text: When Israel came out of Egypt– when the house of Jacob came out from a people who spoke a different language– Israel was God"s territory. the Jordan River retreated! the hills leaped away like lambs! Jordan, why did you retreat? Hills, why did you leap away like lambs? Tremble before the God of Jacob, that flint stone into a spring of water!
The sea saw it happen and ran away;
The mountains leaped away like rams;
Sea, why did you run away?
Mountains, why did you leap away like rams?
the one who turned that rock into a pool of water,

117.verse_text: Praise the LORD , all you nations! Worship him, all you peoples! the LORD "s faithfulness lasts forever! Praise the LORD !

Let the house of Aaron say it:
Let those who honor the LORD say it:
In tight circumstances, I cried out to the LORD .
The LORD is for me –I won"t be afraid.

It"s far better to take refuge in the LORD
It"s far better to take refuge in the LORD

I thank you because you answered me,

LORD , please save us!

You are my God–I will give thanks to you!

I will declare out loud

I will delight in your statutes;
Be good to your servant so I can go on living
Open my eyes so I can examine
I"m an immigrant in the land.
I"m worn out by longing
You rebuke the arrogant, accursed people
Take all their insults and contempt away from me
Even if rulers gather and scheme against me,
Yes, your laws are my joy–
My life is stuck in the dirt.
I confessed my ways and you answered me.
Help me understand what your precepts are about
My spirit sags because of grief.
Remove all false ways from me;
I"ve chosen the way of faithfulness;
I"m holding tight to your laws, LORD .
I run the same path as your commandments
LORD , teach me what your statutes are about,
Help me understand so I can guard your Instruction
Lead me on the trail of your commandments
Turn my heart to your laws,
Turn my eyes away from looking at worthless things.
Confirm your promise to your servant–
Remove the insults that I dread
Look how I desire your precepts!
LORD , let your faithful love come to me–
so I can have a response for those who mock me
Please don"t take your true word out of my mouth,
I will always keep your Instruction,
I will walk around in wide-open spaces,
I will talk about your laws
I will rejoice in your commandments
I will lift up my hands to your commandments

My comfort during my suffering is this:
The arrogant make fun of me to no end,

But I"m seized with anger because of the wicked–
Your statutes have been my songs of praise
LORD , I remember your name at nighttime,
This has been my practice
The LORD is my possession.
I"ve sought your favor with all my heart;
I"ve considered my ways and turned my feet back to your laws.
I hurry to keep your commandments–
Though the wicked have surrounded me with their ropes,
I get up in the middle of the night to give thanks to you
I"m a friend to everyone who honors you
LORD , the world is full of your faithful love!
You have treated your servant well,
Teach me knowledge and good judgment
Before I suffered, I took the wrong way,
You are good and you do good.
The arrogant cover me with their lies,
Their hearts are unfeeling, like blubber,
My suffering was good for me,
The Instruction you"ve given to me is better
Your hands have made me and set me in place.
Then those who honor you will see me and be glad
LORD , I know that your rules are right

Let your compassion come to me so I can live again,
But let the arrogant be ashamed
Let the people who honor you come back to me;
Let my heart be blameless in your statutes
My whole being yearns for your saving help!
My eyes are worn out looking for your word.
because I"ve become like a bottle dried up by smoke,

The arrogant have dug pits for me–
All your commandments are true,
They"ve almost wiped me off the face of the earth!

Your word, LORD ,
Your faithfulness extends from one generation to the next!
Your rules endure to this day
If your Instruction hadn"t been my delight,
I will never forget your precepts
I"m yours–save me
The wicked wait for me,
I"ve seen that everything,

I haven"t set my feet on any evil path
